original: des ni sa rab tu dga' ba la rnam par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni sa rab tu dga' ba la rnam par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the greatness of the miracles of a bodhisattva who is abiding in the Joyful stage.

original: de ltar yang zla ba grags pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang zla ba grags pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Candrapradīpa’s Praise in One Hundred and Eight Names also says:

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: You are born into the family of the Tathāgatas,

original: de yi kun sbyor gsum yang thams cad zad par byas //
analyzed: de yi kun sbyor gsum yang thams cad zad par byas //
translated: and you completely destroy the three fetters.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya g-yo ba skyed par nus pa ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya g-yo ba skyed par nus pa ste //
translated: You are able to shake a hundred world systems,

original: gzhan yang dga' ba rnams 'chang de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dga' ba rnams 'chang de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: and you are a bodhisattva who holds the joys.

original: zhes so // rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan ni lus dang sems rnam par dben pa la brten te /
analyzed: zhes so // rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan ni lus dang sems rnam par dben pa la brten te /
translated: The bodhisattva who has the great power of the bases of miraculous powers relies on physical and mental isolation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'dod chags dang bral pa dang / 'gog ba la yang dag par bstan nas @91b mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa yongs su mthar phyin par byed pa rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'dod chags dang bral pa dang / 'gog ba la yang dag par bstan nas @91b mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa yongs su mthar phyin par byed pa rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The four bases of supernatural power are the four bases of supernatural power that are the completion of the culmination of the entry into the absence of compositional activity, having been taught the cessation that is the freedom from attachment to the discordant side.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de rnams kyi stobs chen po dang gang ldan pa pha rol gnon pa gang yin pa de rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa de rnams kyi stobs chen po dang gang ldan pa pha rol gnon pa gang yin pa de rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan no //
translated: The one who has the great power of those bases of supernatural power is the one who has the great power of the bases of supernatural power.

original: de nyid kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang ; yongs su grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang ; yongs su grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of being the suchness of the imagined, the dependent, and the thoroughly established.🔽How are these three natures asserted to be suchness?

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po 'di la de nyid du ci ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po 'di la de nyid du ci ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: The three natures are asserted as suchness:🔽The imagined is always nonexistent.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum rtag med dang // yod dang kho na ma yin dang // yod dang med de kho na ste /🔽ngo bo nyid ni gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum rtag med dang // yod dang kho na ma yin dang // yod dang med de kho na ste / ngo bo nyid ni gsum du 'dod //
translated: The dependent is existent and nonexistent.🔽The thoroughly established is just existent.

original: ces so // kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the imagined is always nonexistent.

original: de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la kho na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la kho na zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called the imagined reality,

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not erroneous.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang yang dag pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang yang dag pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dependent reality exists, but not in reality, because it is erroneous.

original: de bas na 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the reality of the dependent nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa dang med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa dang med pa kho na ste /
translated: The perfected reality is both existent and nonexistent.

original: de bas 'di ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid la de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: de bas 'di ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid la de kho na nyid de /
translated: Therefore, this is the reality of the perfected reality.

original: de kho na gsum sbyor bas bcom ldan 'das de nyid la de nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na gsum sbyor bas bcom ldan 'das de nyid la de nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught that reality in the statement, “Reality is the reality of the three realities.”🔽The Great Vehicle is the great vehicle because it is the vehicle for the bodhisattvas.🔽It is the vehicle because it conveys one to the other shore.🔽It is great because it is vast.

original: dran pa chen po 'chang ni shin tu che ba'i dran pa ni dran pa chen po ste /
analyzed: dran pa chen po 'chang ni shin tu che ba'i dran pa ni dran pa chen po ste /
translated: It is vast because it is endowed with the vast Dharma.🔽The vast Dharma is the perfections, the elements leading to enlightenment, and the immeasurables.🔽It is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas because it is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.🔽It is the great vehicle because it is the great vehicle.🔽It is the vehicle because it conveys one to the other shore.🔽It is great because it is vast.🔽It is vast because it is endowed with the vast Dharma.🔽The vast Dharma is the perfections, the elements leading to enlightenment, and the immeasurables.🔽It is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas because it is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.🔽It is the great vehicle because it is the great vehicle.🔽It is the vehicle because it conveys one to the other shore.🔽It is great because it is vast.🔽It is vast because it is endowed with the vast Dharma.🔽The vast Dharma is the perfections, the elements leading to enlightenment, and the immeasurables.🔽It is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas because it is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.🔽It is the great vehicle because it is the great vehicle.🔽It is the vehicle because it conveys one to the other shore.🔽It is great because it is vast.🔽It is vast because it is endowed with the vast Dharma.

original: de yang 'dres pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'dres pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The vast Dharma is the perfections, the elements leading to enlightenment, and the immeasurables.🔽It is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas because it is the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.🔽It is the great vehicle because it is the great vehicle.🔽It is the vehicle because it conveys one to the other shore.🔽It is great because it is vast.

original: de 'dzin pas na de la de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na de la de skad gsungs so //
translated: It is vast because it is

original: dran pa bzhi bo ting 'dzin rgyal ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dran pa bzhi bo ting 'dzin rgyal ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four mindfulnesses are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni yan lag sna tshogs pa la zhen pa tsam gyi dngos po ni ma lus te /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni yan lag sna tshogs pa la zhen pa tsam gyi dngos po ni ma lus te /
translated: The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa rnams dben pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //🔽de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //🔽rnam pa bzhi ral yang brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa rnams dben pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do zhes lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o // de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o // rnam pa bzhi ral yang brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //🔽de rgyal bas rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o // de rgyal bas rgyal ba'o //
translated: The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.🔽The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole, which is merely the aggregation of various limbs.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rgyal ba ni dran pa bzhi po ting nge 'dzin rgyal te /🔽bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rgyal ba ni dran pa bzhi po ting nge 'dzin rgyal te /🔽bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
translated: The foundation of mindfulness consisting of body is the body as a whole,

original: byang chub yan lag me tog dga' //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag me tog dga' //
translated: The flowers of the branches of enlightenment,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //
translated: The ocean of qualities of the Tathagata,🔽The knowledge of the eightfold path,

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //🔽zhes pa ni de la byang chub yan lag me tog dga' ni mngon @92a * //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa // zhes pa ni de la byang chub yan lag me tog dga' ni mngon @92a * //
translated: The knowledge of the path of perfect Buddhahood.

original: par 'dus ma byas par 'jug cing mchog tu gyur ba'i dad pa la sogs pa rnams mthong ba'i lam yongs su chub pa chos kyi dbyings kyi spyod yul byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid de rnams nyid ni me tog ste /
analyzed: par 'dus ma byas par 'jug cing mchog tu gyur ba'i dad pa la sogs pa rnams mthong ba'i lam yongs su chub pa chos kyi dbyings kyi spyod yul byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid de rnams nyid ni me tog ste /
translated: The flowers of the branches of enlightenment are the seven branches of enlightenment, the object of the realm of phenomena, which are taught to be the nature of the path of seeing that fully accomplishes the supreme faith and so forth that engage the unconditioned.

original: bsgom pa'i lam 'bras bu'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir na byang chub kyi yan lag ni me tog rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam 'bras bu'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir na byang chub kyi yan lag ni me tog rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: Those very ones are the flowers, because they are the cause of the result of the path of meditation. Therefore, the branches of enlightenment are called the flowers.

original: de rnams kyi dga' ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyis rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams kyi tshul du so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam de mngon du byed pa nyid kyi phyir sems rab tu dga' bar gyur bas na /🔽byang chub yan lag me tog dga' //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dga' ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyis rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer rnams kyi tshul du so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam de mngon du byed pa nyid kyi phyir sems rab tu dga' bar gyur bas na / byang chub yan lag me tog dga' //
translated: Their joy is the path of seeing, which is the direct realization of the nature of the knowable through the wisdom of hearing, which is the nature of awareness. It is the individual appearance of migrating beings as dreams, mirages, and cities of gandharvas.

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams te /
translated: The branches of enlightenment are the flowers of joy.🔽The ocean of qualities of the Tathagata is the qualities of the Tathagata.

original: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: They are the qualities of the Buddha, such as the eighteen distinctive qualities.

original: de rnams nyid mtsho ste rgya che ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yon tan rin po che rnams kyi yang 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho ni bcom ldan das so //
analyzed: de rnams nyid mtsho ste rgya che ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yon tan rin po che rnams kyi yang 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho ni bcom ldan das so //
translated: The Sugata is the ocean of the qualities of the Tathagata, because they are like an ocean, being vast and the source of other precious qualities.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig ni bsgom pa'i lam rab tu bsgoms pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad sngon du bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig ni bsgom pa'i lam rab tu bsgoms pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad sngon du bshad pa rnams so //
translated: Knowing the way of the eightfold path is the noble path of eight branches, which has been well cultivated on the path of cultivation.

original: de rnams kyi tshul ni lam ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshul ni lam ste /
translated: The way of those is the path.

original: thabs zhes ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: thabs zhes ba'i bar du ste /
translated: Up to the means.

original: de rig cing shes pa ni lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig go //
analyzed: de rig cing shes pa ni lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig go //
translated: Knowing that is knowing the way of the eightfold path.

original: yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa ni yang dag sangs rgyas ni gzhan gyis mnang gnye bar ma bstan par rang nyid kyis de kho na thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / dam pa'i lam kun du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa ni yang dag sangs rgyas ni gzhan gyis mnang gnye bar ma bstan par rang nyid kyis de kho na thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / dam pa'i lam kun du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowing the path of perfect Buddhahood is perfect Buddhahood, because it is the realization of thatness by oneself without being taught by another, and because it is the realization of the path of the noble ones.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i lam ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i lam ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The path of that perfect Buddha is the dharmadhatu.

original: de shes pas nas yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig ste /
analyzed: de shes pas nas yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig ste /
translated: The Bhagavat is the one who knows the path to perfect Buddhahood through knowing that.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Bhagavat.

original: sems can kun la shas cher chags //
analyzed: sems can kun la shas cher chags //
translated: He is greatly attached to all sentient beings.

original: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
translated: He is unattached like space.

original: sems can kun gyi yid las skyes //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid las skyes //
translated: He is born from the mind of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs //🔽zhes pa ni de la sems can kun la shas cher chags ni chen po yang de yin la chags pa yang de yin pas na shas cher chags pa ste /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs // zhes pa ni de la sems can kun la shas cher chags ni chen po yang de yin la chags pa yang de yin pas na shas cher chags pa ste /
translated: He is as swift as the mind of all sentient beings.🔽He is greatly attached to all sentient beings because he is great and he is attached.

original: sems can kun la shas cher chags pa ni sems @92b can kun la shas cher chags so //
analyzed: sems can kun la shas cher chags pa ni sems @92b can kun la shas cher chags so //
translated: He is greatly attached to all sentient beings because he is greatly attached to all sentient beings.

original: de la bsdu ba'i dngos po ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la bsdu ba'i dngos po ni bzhi ste /
translated: The means of gathering are four:

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don bzhin spyod pa rnams las sbyin pa ni rngas shes pa'o //🔽snyan par smra ba ni dus shes pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don bzhin spyod pa rnams las sbyin pa ni rngas shes pa'o // snyan par smra ba ni dus shes pa'o //
translated: generosity, pleasant speech, purposeful behavior, and consistency between words and deeds.🔽Generosity is knowing the time.

original: don mthun pa ni 'khor shes pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa ni 'khor shes pa'o //
translated: Pleasant speech is knowing the retinue.

original: don sbyor pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: don sbyor pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: Purposeful behavior is knowing the Dharma.🔽Consistency between words and deeds is knowing the antidotes.

original: sems can mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes par bsgrub pa bsdu ba'i dngos po de rnams kyis sems can thams cad la bdag nyid mngon du byed pas na /
analyzed: sems can mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes par bsgrub pa bsdu ba'i dngos po de rnams kyis sems can thams cad la bdag nyid mngon du byed pas na /
translated: The Lord is greatly attached to all beings, because he manifests himself to all beings through those means of gathering, which are accomplished by the knowledge of the best and the not best among beings.

original: sems can kun la shas cher chags //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can kun la shas cher chags // zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is greatly attached to all beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The Lord is just so in the conventional.

original: don dam par ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid chags pa med pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid chags pa med pa zhes pa ste /
translated: But in the ultimate, the Lord is said to be nonattached,

original: stong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because his nature is emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' lta bu zhes te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' lta bu zhes te /
translated: For that very reason, the Lord is like space,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the embodiment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can kun gyi yid las skyes pa ni sems can gyi yid las skyes so //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid las skyes pa ni sems can gyi yid las skyes so //
translated: He is born from the mind of all beings, born from the mind of beings.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes so //
translated: All beings have the essence of the Tathagata.

original: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i shugs zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i shugs zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The speed of the Tathagata's power is like the speed of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams can gyi yid ltar mgyogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi yid ltar mgyogs pa ste ;
analyzed: sems can thams can gyi yid ltar mgyogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi yid ltar mgyogs pa ste ;
translated: The speed of the Tathagata's power is like the speed of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi sbyor pa la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi sbyor pa la 'jug pas so //
translated: Because he engages in the activities of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes //
translated: He knows the faculties and aims of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrogs pa //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrogs pa //
translated: He captivates the minds of all sentient beings.

original: phung po lnga don de nyid shes //
analyzed: phung po lnga don de nyid shes //
translated: He knows the meaning of the five aggregates.

original: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba //
analyzed: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba //
translated: He possesses the five pure aggregates.

original: zhes pa ni de la sems can kun gyi dbang don shes ni sems can thams cad kyi dbang bo rtul po dang / 'bring po dang / rnon po de rnams kyi don ni sems can gyi dbang don te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la sems can kun gyi dbang don shes ni sems can thams cad kyi dbang bo rtul po dang / 'bring po dang / rnon po de rnams kyi don ni sems can gyi dbang don te /
translated: Here, he knows the faculties and aims of all sentient beings. The faculties of all sentient beings are dull, middling, and sharp. Their aims are the aims of sentient beings.

original: de mkhyen pas na sems can gyi dbang don shes te /
analyzed: de mkhyen pas na sems can gyi dbang don shes te /
translated: Because he knows them, he knows the faculties and aims of sentient beings.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That itself is the Blessed One.

original: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi yid kyi cha ste /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi yid kyi cha ste /
translated: He captivates the minds of all sentient beings. The minds of all sentient beings are the mental factors of all sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pa'i sbo nas 'phrogs pas de de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pa'i sbo nas 'phrogs pas de de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called the Teacher because he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings according to their spiritual faculties.

original: phung bo lnga don de nyid shes ni /
analyzed: phung bo lnga don de nyid shes ni /
translated: The five aggregates are the object of knowledge.

original: de la phung bo lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la phung bo lnga ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The five aggregates are the aggregates of form, sensation, ideation, formations, and consciousness.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / @93a * //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / @93a * //
translated: The aggregate of form is the eye, ear, nose,🔽tongue, body, form, sound, smell,

original: lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: taste, and the tangible, as well as non-informative form.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The aggregate of sensation is the experience of the object.

original: 'du shes kyi phung bo ni yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung bo ni yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of ideation is the apprehension of the sign of the object.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of formations is not associated with mind.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni rnam par shes ba tshogs brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni rnam par shes ba tshogs brgyad rnams so //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the eight collections of consciousness.

original: de rnams kyi don ni phung po lnga'i don te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don ni phung po lnga'i don te /
translated: The meaning of these is the meaning of the five aggregates.

original: de yang spungs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang spungs pa'i don to //
translated: And that is the meaning of “heap.”

original: de'i de nyid ni rnam par dben pa'i don du khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i de nyid ni rnam par dben pa'i don du khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Its reality should be understood as the meaning of “voidness.”

original: phung po lnga don de nyid de /
analyzed: phung po lnga don de nyid de /
translated: The five aggregates are that reality.

original: de yang gcig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de log pa ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gcig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de log pa ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: And that is the characteristic of the one, etc. The negation of that is selflessness.

original: de las ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de de ltar gyur ba'i phung bo lnga'i don mkhyen pas na phung po lnga'i don de nyid shes te /
analyzed: de las ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro // de de ltar gyur ba'i phung bo lnga'i don mkhyen pas na phung po lnga'i don de nyid shes te /
translated: From that, one attains nirvana without remainder.🔽The Blessed One knows the meaning of the five aggregates in that way.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Blessed One who knows the reality of the meaning of the five aggregates.

original: de ltar yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon dbyig gnyen zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The master Vasubandhu also says:

original: chos rnams rab tu rnams 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: chos rnams rab tu rnams 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams //
translated: Without discriminating the dharmas, the afflictions

original: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med pa //
analyzed: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med pa //
translated: Because there is no means of pacifying it.

original: nyon mongs las kyang 'jig rten srid mtsho 'dir 'khyams te //
analyzed: nyon mongs las kyang 'jig rten srid mtsho 'dir 'khyams te //
translated: The world wanders in this ocean of existence due to afflictions and karma.

original: de bas de'i phyir 'di ni ston pas gsungs so lo //
analyzed: de bas de'i phyir 'di ni ston pas gsungs so lo //
translated: Therefore, the Teacher taught this.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ni rnam par dag pa yang de yin phung po yang de nyid yin pas rnam dag phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ni rnam par dag pa yang de yin phung po yang de nyid yin pas rnam dag phung po lnga ste /
translated: The one who holds the five pure aggregates is the one who holds the five pure aggregates because he is pure and also the aggregates themselves.

original: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ba'i mtshan nyid rnams so ;
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ba'i mtshan nyid rnams so ;
translated: They are the characteristics of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge of liberation.

original: / de rnams 'dzin pas na rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: / de rnams 'dzin pas na rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba ste /
translated: He holds them, so he is the one who holds the five pure aggregates.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Bhagavān.

original: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas //
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas //
translated: He abides at the end of all definite exits.

original: nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas //
translated: He is skilled in all definite exits.

original: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas //
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas //
translated: He abides on the path of all definite exits.

original: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa //
translated: He teaches all definite exits.

original: zhes pa ni de la nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas ni 'jig rten gyi mya ngan las 'das pa gang cung zad de rnams kyi mthar thug par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas ni 'jig rten gyi mya ngan las 'das pa gang cung zad de rnams kyi mthar thug par gyur ba'o //
translated: He is the one who stands at the end of all the paths of deliverance, because he is the ultimate goal of all the worldly paths of deliverance.

original: de la gnas pas na nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas so //
analyzed: de la gnas pas na nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas so //
translated: He is the one who stands at the end of all the paths of deliverance because he stands at the end of all the worldly paths of deliverance.

original: nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas ni nyan thos rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la mkhas shing byang bas na nges par 'byung ba kun la @93b mkhas so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas ni nyan thos rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la mkhas shing byang bas na nges par 'byung ba kun la @93b mkhas so //
translated: He is the one who is skilled in all the paths of deliverance, because he is skilled in the paths of deliverance of the Sravakas and is skilled in the paths of deliverance of the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: ngas 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la gnas pa ste //
analyzed: ngas 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la gnas pa ste //
translated: He is the one who stands on the path of deliverance of all the vehicles, because he stands on the path of deliverance of the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: nges 'byung kun gyi lam lag gnas so //
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi lam lag gnas so //
translated: He is the one who stands on the path of deliverance of all the vehicles.

original: nges bar 'byung ba kun ston pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni des par 'byung ba kun no ;
analyzed: nges bar 'byung ba kun ston pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni des par 'byung ba kun no ;
translated: He is the one who teaches all the paths of deliverance, because he teaches the Nirvana of the Perfectly Awakened Ones, which is the deliverance of all.

original: / de ston pa ni rab tu ston pa ste /
analyzed: / de ston pa ni rab tu ston pa ste /
translated: He is the one who teaches all the paths of deliverance.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Blessed One himself.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
translated: The twelve members are the root of the tree of existence.

original: dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang //
analyzed: dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang //
translated: It possesses the twelve pure aspects.

original: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can //
analyzed: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can //
translated: It possesses the aspects of the four truths.

original: shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang //🔽zhes pa la de la yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton ni //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang // zhes pa la de la yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton ni //
translated: It possesses the realization of the eight knowledges.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve members are the root of the tree of existence.🔽The twelve members are ignorance, formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death.

original: ma rig ba dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs pa dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: ma rig ba dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs pa dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: Ignorance is the root of the tree of existence because it is the root of the twelve members.

original: rga shi rnams so //
analyzed: rga shi rnams so //
translated: It is the root because it is the cause of the members.🔽It is the cause of the members because it is the cause of the first member.🔽It is the cause of the first member because it is the obscuration of reality.🔽It is the obscuration of reality because it is the obscuration of the vision of reality, as it is desired, because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of reality.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of reality because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the four noble truths.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the four noble truths because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of suffering.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of suffering because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the impermanence of suffering.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the impermanence of suffering because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the arising of suffering.

original: de la de kho na nyid la sgrib pa'i phyir na ma rig pa ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don mthong ba la 'gags byed pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid la sgrib pa'o //🔽'debs ba'i phyir na 'du byed de /
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid la sgrib pa'i phyir na ma rig pa ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don mthong ba la 'gags byed pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid la sgrib pa'o //🔽'debs ba'i phyir na 'du byed de /
translated: It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the arising of suffering because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the cessation of suffering.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the cessation of suffering because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the path to the cessation of suffering.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the path to the cessation of suffering because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the path to the cessation of suffering.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the path to the cessation of suffering because it is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the path to the cessation of suffering.🔽It is the obscuration of the vision of the meaning of the path to the cessation of

original: des rnams par shes pa la las kyi bag chags so sor 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rnams par shes pa la las kyi bag chags so sor 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it deposits the seeds of action in consciousness.

original: khrid pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: khrid pa'i phyir na rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is so called because it distributes.

original: skye ba'i sar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It distributes the seeds in the place of rebirth.

original: kun 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir na ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: kun 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir na ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Name-and-form is so called because it holds together.

original: bdag gi dngos po rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir na skye mched drug go //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir na skye mched drug go //
translated: The six sense-spheres are so called because they complete the individual.

original: gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'i phyir na reg pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'i phyir na reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is so called because it is the coming together of three.

original: nye bar spyod pa'i phyir na tshor ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i phyir na tshor ba'o //
translated: Sensation is so called because it experiences.

original: sdud pa'i phyir na srid pa'o //
analyzed: sdud pa'i phyir na srid pa'o //
translated: Becoming is so called because it accumulates.

original: las kyis 'phangs pa'i srid pa phyi ma dang sbyar ba'i phyir na len ba'o ;🔽/ rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa'i dod chags la sogs pa mngon du bye dpa'i phyir na srid pa ste /
analyzed: las kyis 'phangs pa'i srid pa phyi ma dang sbyar ba'i phyir na len ba'o ; / rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun pa'i dod chags la sogs pa mngon du bye dpa'i phyir na srid pa ste /
translated: Clinging is so called because it joins to the next existence projected by action.🔽Existence is so called because it is the actualization of attachment, etc.

original: las byas ba'i srid pa phyi ma la rnam par smin pa 'byung zhing mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las byas ba'i srid pa phyi ma la rnam par smin pa 'byung zhing mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: which is in conformity with the arising of consciousness, because the actualization of the future existence that is projected by action occurs and is actualized.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phyir na skye ba dang rga shi rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phyir na skye ba dang rga shi rnams so //
translated: Birth, aging, and death are for the sake of suffering.

original: de bas na yan lag bcu gnyis //
analyzed: de bas na yan lag bcu gnyis //
translated: Therefore, there are twelve members.

original: de rnams kyi 'khor ba'i srid rtsa ni nye bar len pa'i phyir phung go lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'khor ba'i srid rtsa ni nye bar len pa'i phyir phung go lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The root of existence in cyclic life is the five aggregates, because they are appropriated.

original: de gang gis rtsa nas phyung zhing bton pa de /
analyzed: de gang gis rtsa nas phyung zhing bton pa de /
translated: That which is pulled out by the root is

original: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis srid rtsa bton //
translated: The twelve members, the root of existence.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar yang dus dang / mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang dus dang / mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa /
translated: In the same way, the Time and Limit Analysis says:

original: sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa dang / khrid pa'i phyir dang / @94a * //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa dang / khrid pa'i phyir dang / @94a * //
translated: Because of obscuration, because of planting, because of leading,

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of grasping,

original: rdzogs byed phyir dang gsum gcod phyir //
analyzed: rdzogs byed phyir dang gsum gcod phyir //
translated: Because of completion, because of cutting off three,

original: nye bar spyod cing sdud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar spyod cing sdud pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of enjoyment and gathering,

original: sbyor ba'i phyir dang mngon du'i phyir //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i phyir dang mngon du'i phyir //
translated: Because of connection, because of manifestation,

original: sdug bsngal phyir na 'gro nyon mongs //🔽zhes so // dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir na 'gro nyon mongs // zhes so // dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ni //
translated: Because of suffering, beings are afflicted.🔽The twelve pure aspects are

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis ni skye mched bcu gnyis rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis ni skye mched bcu gnyis rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The twelve pure aspects are the twelve bases.

original: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa gnyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa gnyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of the two kinds of conceptualization, that is, the conceptualization of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de rnams 'dzin pas na dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams 'dzin pas na dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang ngo //
translated: It is the bearer of the twelve aspects of purity because it bears those aspects.

original: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
translated: The one who has the aspects of the mode of the four noble truths is the one who has the aspects of the four noble truths. The four noble truths are the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path.

original: bden pa bzhi po de rnams kyi tshul ni lam mo //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po de rnams kyi tshul ni lam mo //
translated: The mode of those four truths is the path.

original: de nyid kyi rnam pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de bzhin bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de bzhin bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can te /
translated: The one who has the mode of those aspects is the one who has the aspects of the mode of the four truths.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //🔽shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang ni /🔽de la shes pa brgyad ni ji skad gsungs pa'i chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'og pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so // shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang ni / de la shes pa brgyad ni ji skad gsungs pa'i chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'og pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang /
translated: That one is the Bhagavat.🔽The one who bears the realization of the eight knowledges is the one who bears the realization of the eight knowledges.

original: mi skye ba shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa rnams so //
translated: The eight knowledges are the knowledge of things as they are, subsequent knowledge, the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin, the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of elimination, and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de rnams rtogs pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams rtogs pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Realizing those is making them manifest.

original: de 'dzin pas na shes par brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na shes par brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang ste /
translated: He is the bearer of the realization of the eight knowledges because he holds them.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Bhagavān.

original: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan /
analyzed: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan /
translated: He has the twelve aspects of the meaning of the truths.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
translated: He knows the sixteen aspects. He is enlightened by the twenty aspects.🔽He is supreme among those who know all the aspects of the buddhas.

original: rnam pa sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa ni de la bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan ni bden pa rnams kyi don ni bden pa'i don te /
analyzed: rnam pa sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa ni de la bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan ni bden pa rnams kyi don ni bden pa'i don te /
translated: He has the twelve aspects of the meaning of the truths. The meaning of the truths is the meaning of the four noble truths.

original: de dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi rang tu rnam par 'byed pas chos kyi 'khor lo rnam par bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi rang tu rnam par 'byed pas chos kyi 'khor lo rnam par bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: He is the one who thoroughly differentiates them with the twelve aspects. He turns the wheel of dharma with the twelve aspects three times.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba'o //
translated: The truth of suffering has the aspects of impermanence, suffering, and emptiness.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa la kun 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang tu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa la kun 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang tu skyed pa'o //
translated: The truth of origin has the aspects of origin, cause, and strong production.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation has the aspects of cessation, peace, and excellence.

original: lam gyi bden pa la lam dang ; rigs pa dang / sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la lam dang ; rigs pa dang / sgrub pa'o //
translated: the method, and the practice.

original: de de ltar gyur ba skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das 'di ni /🔽bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
analyzed: de de ltar gyur ba skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das 'di ni / bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
translated: Since the Lord, having become such, turned the wheel of the Dharma of twelve aspects in accordance with the fortune of the disciples,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: he is the one who possesses the twelve aspects of the truth.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ni /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ni /
translated: He is the one who knows the sixteen aspects.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa @94b la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba dang / bdag med ba rnams yid la byed pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa @94b la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba dang / bdag med ba rnams yid la byed pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In this regard, with regard to the truth of suffering in the desire realm, by attending to impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, the receptivity to the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to suffering and the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to suffering arise.

original: de nyis kyis kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de rnams rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: de nyis kyis kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de rnams rab tu spong ngo //
translated: And by these two, the ten afflictions of the desire realm are completely abandoned.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la de bzhin du yid la byed pas sdug bsngal la rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la de bzhin du yid la byed pas sdug bsngal la rjes su chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering arise in the same way by keeping in mind the truth of suffering that is to be abandoned by seeing the path in the desire realm.

original: de gnyis kyis kyang de rnams nyid las khong khro ma gtogs pa gzugs na spyod pa dgu dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis kyang de rnams nyid las khong khro ma gtogs pa gzugs na spyod pa dgu dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dgu ste /
translated: Those two also abandon the nine objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the form realm and the nine objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the formless realm, with the exception of anger.

original: de ltar bco brgyad yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bco brgyad yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are eighteen.

original: de ltar khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pas na chos dang / rjes su dang / bzod pa dang / shes pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi rnams kyi phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba las spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs pas na chos dang / rjes su dang / bzod pa dang / shes pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi rnams kyi phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba las spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by directly realizing the truth of suffering of the three realms, the twenty-eight negative tendencies that are characteristics of the four aspects of Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, perseverance for subsequent knowledge, and subsequent knowledge are abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: phra rgyas bcu po 'di rnams nyid las 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams ma gtogs par 'dod pa'i khams kyi gzhan phra rgyas bdun ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab tu bskyed pa dang rkyen nyid du yid la byed pas
analyzed: phra rgyas bcu po 'di rnams nyid las 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams ma gtogs par 'dod pa'i khams kyi gzhan phra rgyas bdun ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa la rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab tu bskyed pa dang rkyen nyid du yid la byed pas
translated: From among these ten negative tendencies, seven negative tendencies of the desire realm are abandoned by the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin and Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin that focus on the truth of origin in the desire realm as cause, origin, strong generation and condition.

original: de nyid kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa de gnyis kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa de gnyis kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are abandoned by those two: perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin and Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin.

original: de rnams nyid las khong khro ma gtogs pa khams gnyis la phra rgyas bcu gnyis kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas te kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa gnyis kyis spong bar 'gyur bas na de de ltar phra rgyas dgu bcu kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams nyid las khong khro ma gtogs pa khams gnyis la phra rgyas bcu gnyis kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas te kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / shes pa gnyis kyis spong bar 'gyur bas na de de ltar phra rgyas dgu bcu kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus ninety negative tendencies are abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba bzhir yid la byas pas kun 'byung la gsungs pa'i phra rgyas bdun po de kho na 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba bzhir yid la byas pas kun 'byung la gsungs pa'i phra rgyas bdun po de kho na 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: Similarly, seven negative tendencies that are said to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin are completely abandoned by the two: perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation that is the antidote to the truth of origin and Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation that is the antidote to the truth of origin.

original: chos shes pa gnyis kyis yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa gnyis kyis yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are abandoned by the two: perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation and Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation.

original: de ltar rjes su bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa gnyis kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis spong bar byed pas na khams gsum gyi phra rgyas bcu dgu sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i @95a * //🔽bden pa mthong ba las spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa gnyis kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis spong bar byed pas na khams gsum gyi phra rgyas bcu dgu sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i @95a * // bden pa mthong ba las spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the two subsequent perseverance and subsequent knowledge abandon the twelve negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the desire realm, the twelve negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the form realm and the twelve negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the formless realm, they abandon the nineteen negative tendencies of the three realms through seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi bden pa lam dang / rigs pa dang / nges par 'byin pa dang / sgrub pa dang / rnam par bzhir yid la byas pas lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi bden pa lam dang / rigs pa dang / nges par 'byin pa dang / sgrub pa dang / rnam par bzhir yid la byas pas lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: Similarly, in the desire realm, the four aspects of the truth of path that is the path leading to the cessation of suffering are the path, correct method, definite release, and practice.

original: chos shes pa de gnyis kyi gong du gsungs pa'i bdun kho na la tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa bsnan pas brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa de gnyis kyi gong du gsungs pa'i bdun kho na la tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa bsnan pas brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The two, perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of path and Dharma knowledge of the truth of path, abandon the eight negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, which are the seven previously mentioned negative tendencies plus the overesteeming of discipline and ritual.

original: lam rjes su bzod pa dang / shes pa gnyis kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bcu bzhi ni lam mthong ba las spong bar 'gyur bas na de ltar na phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa gnyis lam gyi bden pa mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam rjes su bzod pa dang / shes pa gnyis kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bcu bzhi ni lam mthong ba las spong bar 'gyur bas na de ltar na phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa gnyis lam gyi bden pa mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus twenty two negative tendencies are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: de ltar bas na rnam par bcu drug gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon du byed pas khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa med cing phyin ci ma log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa'i de kho na skye ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bas na rnam par bcu drug gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon du byed pas khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa med cing phyin ci ma log pa'i dngos po rtogs pa'i de kho na skye ba ste /
translated: Since the four truths are directly perceived by means of these sixteen aspects, the three realms are free of affliction and the reality that is the realization of unmistaken things arises.

original: de rig cing mkhyen pas na /
analyzed: de rig cing mkhyen pas na /
translated: Since the Bhagavan knows and understands that reality,

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ste /
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ste /
translated: he is one who knows reality in sixteen aspects.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Bhagavan.

original: rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa ni phung po lnga rnams rnam pa nyi shu so sor kun du rtog pa'i rnam pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa ni phung po lnga rnams rnam pa nyi shu so sor kun du rtog pa'i rnam pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Enlightenment by means of twenty aspects is the actualization of perfect enlightenment by means of the twenty aspects of the individual conceptualization of the five aggregates.

original: gzugs nyid bdag yin //
analyzed: gzugs nyid bdag yin //
translated: Form is the self.

original: gzugs la bdag gnas //
analyzed: gzugs la bdag gnas //
translated: The self is in form.

original: gzugs bdag gi yin //
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi yin //
translated: Form is mine.

original: bdag gzugs dang ldan /🔽tshor ba bdag yin /🔽tshor ba la bdag gnas /
analyzed: bdag gzugs dang ldan / tshor ba bdag yin / tshor ba la bdag gnas /
translated: I am endowed with form.🔽Feeling is the self.🔽The self is in feeling.

original: tshor ba bdag gi yin /
analyzed: tshor ba bdag gi yin /
translated: Feeling is mine.

original: bdag tshor ba dang ldan /🔽'du shes bdag yin /🔽'du shes la bdag gnas /
analyzed: bdag tshor ba dang ldan / 'du shes bdag yin / 'du shes la bdag gnas /
translated: I am endowed with feeling.🔽Perception is the self.🔽The self is in perception.

original: 'du shes bdag gi yin //
analyzed: 'du shes bdag gi yin //
translated: Perception is mine.

original: bdag 'du shes dang ldan /🔽'du byed bdag yin /🔽'du byed la bdag gnas //
analyzed: bdag 'du shes dang ldan / 'du byed bdag yin / 'du byed la bdag gnas //
translated: I am endowed with perception.🔽Disposition is the self.🔽The self is in disposition.

original: 'du byed bdag gi yin /
analyzed: 'du byed bdag gi yin /
translated: Disposition is mine.

original: bdag 'du byed dang ldan /
analyzed: bdag 'du byed dang ldan /
translated: I am endowed with disposition.

original: rnam par shes pa bdag yin /🔽rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas /🔽rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag yin / rnam par shes pa la bdag gnas / rnam par shes pa bdag gi yin /
translated: Consciousness is the self.🔽The self is in consciousness.🔽Consciousness is mine.

original: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: I am endowed with consciousness.

original: de ltar phye ba'i rnam pa nyi shu rnams kyis gang gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtog pa med pa'i ye shes la lhag par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar phye ba'i rnam pa nyi shu rnams kyis gang gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtog pa med pa'i ye shes la lhag par rtogs pa ste /
translated: By means of these twenty distinctions, the bodhisattva realizes the nonconceptual gnosis of perfect enlightenment.

original: de rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the twentyfold enlightenment.

original: de ltar klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is that the venerable Nagarjuna has said:

original: rig pa yis ni rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: rig pa yis ni rnam dpyad na //
translated: When analyzed by the wise,

original: phung po las ni gzhan kun na //🔽mu stegs rnams kyis gang brtags pa'i /
analyzed: phung po las ni gzhan kun na // mu stegs rnams kyis gang brtags pa'i /
translated: in all the other systems,

original: @95b bdag ni 'ga' yang yod ma yin /
analyzed: @95b bdag ni 'ga' yang yod ma yin /
translated: there is no self at all,🔽as imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: phung po yin na mi rtag //
analyzed: phung po yin na mi rtag //
translated: If it were the aggregates, it would be impermanent.

original: de yang bdag gi tshul ma yin //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi tshul ma yin //
translated: That is not the way a self would be.

original: rtag dang mi rtag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it would be neither permanent nor impermanent,

original: rten dang brten pa'ang nam yang med /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'ang nam yang med /
translated: there would never be a support or something supported.

original: ces so / rnam par sangs rgyas kun rig mchog gi tshig gsum gyi don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces so / rnam par sangs rgyas kun rig mchog gi tshig gsum gyi don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the three lines “The completely awakened one, the supreme knower of all,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sbrul pa'i sku //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sbrul pa'i sku //
translated: the body of the buddhas, the emanator of emanations,

original: dpag med mtha' yas 'byed pa po //
analyzed: dpag med mtha' yas 'byed pa po //
translated: the one who emanates immeasurable, infinite emanations,

original: skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
analyzed: skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
translated: the one who realizes all in every instant,

original: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig //
translated: the one who knows the meaning of every instant of mind”

original: ces pa ni de la dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sbrul pa'i sku rnams ni dpag med sangs rgyas sbrul ba ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni de la dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sbrul pa'i sku rnams ni dpag med sangs rgyas sbrul ba ste /
translated: is as follows: The emanation bodies of the immeasurable buddhas are the immeasurable emanations of buddhas.

original: de rnams kyi sku ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: The bodies of those are the assemblies.

original: dpag med sangs rgyas sbrul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: dpag med sangs rgyas sbrul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The bodies of the immeasurable emanations of buddhas are the immeasurable emanations of buddhas.

original: ji lta ji ltar 'dul ba'i sems can rnams yongs su smin pa'i dbang gi phyir na dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i mtha' 'gyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar 'dul ba'i sems can rnams yongs su smin pa'i dbang gi phyir na dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i mtha' 'gyed par byed pa ste /
translated: And in order to bring beings to full maturity, they send out infinite emanations.🔽

original: 'phro ba gang yin pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kho na yin pas na /
analyzed: 'phro ba gang yin pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kho na yin pas na /
translated: The Bhagavat is the one who sends forth, who emanates, the infinite, limitless emanations of buddhas, in order to ripen those sentient beings who are to be disciplined.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbrul pa'i sku //🔽dpag med mtha' yas 'gyed pa po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbrul pa'i sku // dpag med mtha' yas 'gyed pa po //
translated: The buddhas’ emanation bodies

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs pa ni skad cig kyang de yin la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs pa ni skad cig kyang de yin la /
translated: send forth infinite, limitless emanations.

original: thams cad kyang de yin pas skad cig thams cad de /
analyzed: thams cad kyang de yin pas skad cig thams cad de /
translated: The realization of all instants is the realization of all instants.

original: skad cig bcu drug gi bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: skad cig bcu drug gi bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: All instants are the sixteen instants.

original: de rnams shes pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams shes pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of those is the realization of stream enterer.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavat is just that.

original: de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /🔽go rims bzhin du cher 'jug pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsungs pa / go rims bzhin du cher 'jug pa //
translated: Thus it is said in the Abhidharma:

original: skad cig bcu drug mthong lam gyis //
analyzed: skad cig bcu drug mthong lam gyis //
translated: The sixteen instants of the path of seeing

original: de yi 'bras bu spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu spangs pa'o //
translated: are the result of that, the abandonment.

original: zhes so // sems kyi skad cig don kun rig ni sems can thams cad kyi skad cig kun no //
analyzed: zhes so // sems kyi skad cig don kun rig ni sems can thams cad kyi skad cig kun no //
translated: Thus.🔽The knowledge of all the meanings in a moment of mind is all the moments of all sentient beings.

original: de'i don mkhyen pas ni sems kyi skad cig don kun rig ste ;
analyzed: de'i don mkhyen pas ni sems kyi skad cig don kun rig ste ;
translated: The knowledge of their meanings is the knowledge of all the meanings in a moment of mind.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That is the Bhagavat.

original: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul gyis //
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul gyis //
translated: By the various vehicles, methods, and ways,

original: 'gro ba'i don la 'phro bar byed //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la 'phro bar byed //
translated: he emanates for the sake of migrating beings.

original: theg pa gsum gyis nges 'byung la //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis nges 'byung la //
translated: From the three vehicles, there is definite emergence;

original: theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas // zhes pa ste /
translated: in the one vehicle, there is the result.🔽Therein, the various vehicles, etc.

original: de la theg pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ni sna tshogs par gyur ba'i theg pa ni theg pa sna tshogs te /🔽nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de la theg pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ni sna tshogs par gyur ba'i theg pa ni theg pa sna tshogs te / nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The various vehicles are the vehicles of the sravakas, etc.

original: de rnams kyi tshul ni lam mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshul ni lam mo //
translated: Their ways are the paths.

original: de'i thabs ni theg pa sna tshogs thabs kyi tshul lo /
analyzed: de'i thabs ni theg pa sna tshogs thabs kyi tshul lo /
translated: Their methods are the various vehicles, methods, and ways.

original: de'i phyir theg pa sna tshogs thabs kyi tshul des 'gro ba rnams kyi don byed pa ni 'gro don te /🔽de la rnam par rtogs shing 'phro bas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa sna tshogs thabs kyi tshul des 'gro ba rnams kyi don byed pa ni 'gro don te /🔽de la rnam par rtogs shing 'phro bas na //
translated: Therefore, by those various vehicles, methods, and ways, he emanates for the sake of migrating beings.🔽He emanates for the sake of migrating beings.

original: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul @96a * //
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul @96a * //
translated: By various vehicles, methods, and means,

original: gyis ; /'gro ba'i don la 'phro bar byed do //
analyzed: gyis ; /'gro ba'i don la 'phro bar byed do //
translated: he sends forth for the sake of beings.

original: theg pa gsum gyis nges 'byung la ni 'dul ba'i dbang gis theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung bas na theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba la'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis nges 'byung la ni 'dul ba'i dbang gis theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung bas na theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba la'o //
translated: In the three vehicles, in the three vehicles' certain deliverance, in the three vehicles' certain deliverance, because of the power of discipline, he sends forth.

original: don dam par ni theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas zhes pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate, in the one vehicle's result, in the one vehicle's result, because of the one vehicle's result.

original: gcig kho na'i theg pa ni theg pa gcig go //
analyzed: gcig kho na'i theg pa ni theg pa gcig go //
translated: The one vehicle is the one vehicle.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its result is characterized by unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de la gnas pas na theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas te /
analyzed: de la gnas pas na theg pa gcig gis 'bras bur gnas te /
translated: In it he sends forth, in the one vehicle's result.

original: de ltar yang theg pa ni gcig kho na ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang theg pa ni gcig kho na ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the vehicle is only one,

original: theg pa chen po'o zhes so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'o zhes so //
translated: namely, the Great Vehicle.

original: de ltar yang kampa la'i zhal snga nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang kampa la'i zhal snga nas gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, Kambala says,

original: 'thab pa'i glang chen mgon po bor nas mgon med bong bu'i theg pas su zhig 'gro //
analyzed: 'thab pa'i glang chen mgon po bor nas mgon med bong bu'i theg pas su zhig 'gro //
translated: Who, having abandoned the elephant of battle, would go by the vehicle of the donkey, which is without a protector?

original: rigs ldan phyug po'i bud med khyad par spang nas smad 'tshong 'dod pa bzhin //
analyzed: rigs ldan phyug po'i bud med khyad par spang nas smad 'tshong 'dod pa bzhin //
translated: Except for the women of the wealthy and the nobility, he is like a lustful man who desires a prostitute.

original: zhes so // nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa //
analyzed: zhes so // nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa //
translated: The self that is pure of the elements of the afflictions, and which causes the exhaustion of the elements of karma,

original: chu bo rgya mtsho kun las brgal //
analyzed: chu bo rgya mtsho kun las brgal //
translated: has crossed over all the rivers and oceans.

original: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
translated: He has emerged from the wilderness of attachment.

original: zhes pa ni de la nyon mongs khams dag pa'i bdag ni nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi khams rnams ni nyon mongs khams rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la nyon mongs khams dag pa'i bdag ni nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi khams rnams ni nyon mongs khams rnams te /
translated: Here, the self that is pure of the elements of the afflictions is the self that is pure of the elements that are the nature of the afflictions.

original: khams bco brgyad do //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad do //
translated: The elements are the eighteen elements.

original: de'i phyir na de rnams las rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de rnams las rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag go //
translated: Therefore, the self that is pure of them is the self that is pure of the elements of the afflictions.

original: las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa ni dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyi khams rnams ni las kyi khams rnams te /
analyzed: las kyi khams rnams zad byed pa ni dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyi khams rnams ni las kyi khams rnams te /
translated: The cause of the exhaustion of the elements of karma is the elements of karma that are virtuous and so forth.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The elements of karma are called the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de rnams zad par byed pas na zad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams zad par byed pas na zad par byed pa ste /
translated: Because they cause the exhaustion of those, they are the cause of the exhaustion of the elements of karma.

original: 'joms par byed pas zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'joms par byed pas zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of “destroyer” is “one who causes destruction” of those.

original: de rnams 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽chu bo rgya mtshe kun las brgal ba ni chu bo ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de rnams 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las byed pa'i phyir ro // chu bo rgya mtshe kun las brgal ba ni chu bo ni bzhi ste /
translated: Because they perform the action of destroying them.🔽The river is the ocean, because it is crossed.

original: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: There are four rivers: the river of desire, the river of existence, the river of views, and the river of ignorance.

original: de la lta ba dang ma rig pa las gzhan la 'dod pa'i zag pa nyid 'dod pa'i chu bo rnams te /
analyzed: de la lta ba dang ma rig pa las gzhan la 'dod pa'i zag pa nyid 'dod pa'i chu bo rnams te /
translated: Among them, the contaminants of desire other than views and ignorance are the river of desire,

original: rdzas nyi shu rtsa dgu rnams so //
analyzed: rdzas nyi shu rtsa dgu rnams so //
translated: which are twenty-nine substances.

original: srid pa'i zag pa nyid srid pa'i chu bo ste //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa nyid srid pa'i chu bo ste //
translated: The contaminants of existence are the river of existence,

original: rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: rdzas nyi shu rtsa brgyad rnams so //
translated: which are twenty-eight substances.

original: khams gsum gyi lta ba rnams ni lta ba'i chu bo ste rdzas sum cu rtsa drug rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi lta ba rnams ni lta ba'i chu bo ste rdzas sum cu rtsa drug rnams so //
translated: The views of the three realms are the river of views, which are thirty-six substances.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa nyid ma rig pa'i chu bo rnams te rdzas bco lnga rnams so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa nyid ma rig pa'i chu bo rnams te rdzas bco lnga rnams so //
translated: The contaminants of ignorance are the river of ignorance, which are fifteen substances.

original: de nyid @96b rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: de nyid @96b rgya mtsho ste /
translated: That is the ocean,

original: mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is vast.

original: chu bo rgya mtsho de rnams las gang gis yang dag par brgal ba de de ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: chu bo rgya mtsho de rnams las gang gis yang dag par brgal ba de de ltar gsungs te /
translated: He is so called because he has crossed over all the rivers and oceans,

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he has gone beyond all the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba //
translated: He has emerged from the wilderness of practice,

original: ye shes tsam la snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: ye shes tsam la snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: and is absorbed in mere intuition,

original: rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par bshad //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes ni mngon par bshad //
translated: and is called a yogi.

original: ces pa ni de nyid dgon pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni de nyid dgon pa ste /
translated: This is the wilderness,

original: shes dka' ba'i phyir dang / rgal dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes dka' ba'i phyir dang / rgal dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to know and difficult to cross.
