original: de las nges par 'byung ba ni brgal ba ste /
analyzed: de las nges par 'byung ba ni brgal ba ste /
translated: He has emerged from it, having crossed over.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyi yongs su mthar phyin pa nyid kyi phyir na sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyi yongs su mthar phyin pa nyid kyi phyir na sbyor ba'i dgon pa las byung ba ste /
translated: He has emerged from the wilderness of practice, because he has gone to the end of mundane and transcendent practices.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //🔽nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so // nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs //
translated: He is the Transcendent Lord.

original: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa //
analyzed: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa //
translated: He has utterly abandoned the afflictions, the secondary afflictions,🔽and the instinctual propensities.

original: snying rje chen po shes rab thabs //
analyzed: snying rje chen po shes rab thabs //
translated: He is great compassion, intuition, and skill in means.

original: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
analyzed: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
translated: He is Amogha, accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: zhes pa ni de la nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for the afflictions, secondary afflictions, and so on,

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa drug go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa drug go //
translated: the afflictions are the six such as attachment.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni khro ba la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni khro ba la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions are the twenty-four such as wrath.

original: kun nyon mongs ni sdug bsngal bdun no //
analyzed: kun nyon mongs ni sdug bsngal bdun no //
translated: The afflictions are the seven sufferings.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de rnams nyid bag chags dang bcas par gtan du spangs pa dang gang ldan pa de ni /🔽nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de rnams nyid bag chags dang bcas par gtan du spangs pa dang gang ldan pa de ni / nyon mongs nye ba'i kun nyon mongs //
translated: He who possesses the complete abandonment of those phenomena of afflictions, secondary afflictions, and afflictions, together with their imprints,🔽is Amogha, accomplishing the aims of beings.🔽He is Amogha, accomplishing the aims of beings,🔽who has completely abandoned the afflictions, secondary afflictions,

original: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bag chags bcas par gtan spangs pa // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and afflictions, together with their imprints.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / len pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / len pa rnams so //
translated: Alternatively, the afflictions are ignorance, craving, and grasping.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions are formation and becoming.

original: gzhan rnams ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The others are as above.

original: snying rje che dang shes rab thabs //
analyzed: snying rje che dang shes rab thabs //
translated: Great compassion, wisdom, and means.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs ni shes rab dang thabs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs ni shes rab dang thabs te /
translated: Wisdom and means are wisdom and means.

original: snying rje yang de yin la shes rab chen po yang de yin pas snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: snying rje yang de yin la shes rab chen po yang de yin pas snying rje chen po'o //
translated: It is compassion and it is great wisdom, thus it is great compassion.

original: shes rab dang thabs dang snying rje chen po gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dang snying rje chen po gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is wisdom, means, and great compassion,

original: snying rje dang shes rab thabs te /
analyzed: snying rje dang shes rab thabs te /
translated: is compassion, wisdom, and means.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That is the Bhagavān.🔽Having a meaningful purpose, he acts for the welfare of the world.

original: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni don yod pa ni 'bras bu yod pa'o //
analyzed: don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa ni don yod pa ni 'bras bu yod pa'o //
translated: He is meaningful because he has a result.

original: don yod kyang de yin la 'gro ba'i don yang de nyid yin pas don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: don yod kyang de yin la 'gro ba'i don yang de nyid yin pas don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
translated: He is meaningful and he is the one who acts for the welfare of the world, thus he is the one who has a meaningful purpose, he acts for the welfare of the world.

original: de byed pas na don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa ste /
analyzed: de byed pas na don yod 'gro ba'i don byed pa ste /
translated: Because he does that, he has a meaningful purpose, he acts for the welfare of the world.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That is the Bhagavān.

original: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing //
analyzed: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing //
translated: He has abandoned the meaning of all perceptions,

original: rnam shes don ni 'gog par 'dzin //
analyzed: rnam shes don ni 'gog par 'dzin //
translated: and he holds the meaning of consciousness to be cessation.

original: sems can kun yid yul @97a * //
analyzed: sems can kun yid yul @97a * //
translated: He possesses the mental objects of all sentient beings,

original: dang ldan // sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rig pa //
analyzed: dang ldan // sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rig pa //
translated: and he knows the minds of all buddhas.🔽This is

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the following:🔽

original: de la 'du shes kun gyi don spangs ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'du shes kun gyi don spangs ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams te /
translated: The meaning of the term “cessation of ideation” is the meditative attainment of cessation, the meditative attainment of non-ideation, and the state of non-ideation.

original: gzugs kyi khams su'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su'o //
translated: They exist in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang nye bar skye ba'i gnas dang po ni na ma mkha' yas skye mched de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang nye bar skye ba'i gnas dang po ni na ma mkha' yas skye mched de /
translated: The first place of rebirth in the formless realm is the sphere of infinite space.

original: de rnams gsum ni 'du shes kyi sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams gsum ni 'du shes kyi sgrar gsungs so //
translated: These three are called the ideationless meditative attainment.

original: 'du shes gsum po de rnams kyis spangs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i don gang yin pa de 'du shes don spangs shing ste /
analyzed: 'du shes gsum po de rnams kyis spangs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i don gang yin pa de 'du shes don spangs shing ste /
translated: The meaning of the term “cessation of ideation” is the mind and mental factors that are abandoned by those three types of ideation.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so ;🔽/ rnam shes don ni rnam par shes pa'i don yin pas rnam shes te /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so ; / rnam shes don ni rnam par shes pa'i don yin pas rnam shes te /
translated: That is the Bhagavān.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the term “sphere of infinite consciousness” is the formless realm.

original: skye ba'i gnas gnyis po ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas gnyis po ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de /
translated: The second place of rebirth is the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de rnam par shes pa kho na la dmigs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa kho na la dmigs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it focuses on just consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi don dang gang ldan pa de rnam shes ta de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don dang gang ldan pa de rnam shes ta de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The one who possesses that reality is consciousness, and that is the Bhagavat.

original: 'gog pa 'dzin ni de nyid kyis skye ba'i gnas bzhi pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gog pa 'dzin ni de nyid kyis skye ba'i gnas bzhi pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: The one who holds cessation is the one who holds the fourth abode of birth and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de 'dzin pas na 'gog pa 'dzin te /
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na 'gog pa 'dzin te /
translated: Because he holds that, he is the one who holds cessation.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That is the Bhagavat.

original: sems can kun yid yul dang ldan ni sems can thams cad kyi yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de /
analyzed: sems can kun yid yul dang ldan ni sems can thams cad kyi yid ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de /
translated: The one who possesses the object of the minds of all sentient beings is the one who possesses the object of the afflicted mind of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid do //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid do //
translated: That is the mind of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid yul dang gang ldan pa de sems can kun yid yul dang ldan te /
analyzed: de nyid yul dang gang ldan pa de sems can kun yid yul dang ldan te /
translated: The one who possesses that object is the one who possesses the object of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That is the Bhagavat.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rig pa ni dus gsum na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rig pa ni dus gsum na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: The one who knows the minds of all buddhas is the one who knows the mind of all buddhas abiding in the three times, which is the gnosis of the utterly pure dharmadhatu.

original: de rig pas na sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rig pa'o //
analyzed: de rig pas na sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rig pa'o //
translated: Because he knows that, he is the one who knows the minds of all buddhas.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / de ni drir bcas dri ma med //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / de ni drir bcas dri ma med //
translated: it is both with stains and stainless.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
translated: Like the water element, gold, and space,

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: it is accepted as pure in the same way.

original: ces so // sems can kun gyi yid la gnas /
analyzed: ces so // sems can kun gyi yid la gnas /
translated: It abides in the minds of all sentient beings.

original: de dag sems ni mnyam nyid son //🔽sems can kun yid tshim par byed //
analyzed: de dag sems ni mnyam nyid son // sems can kun yid tshim par byed //
translated: It is the equality of their minds.🔽It satisfies the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
translated: It delights the minds of all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni de la sems can kun gyi yid la gnas ni sems can thams cad kyi yid ni sems so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la sems can kun gyi yid la gnas ni sems can thams cad kyi yid ni sems so //
translated: Here, “it abides in the minds of all sentient beings” means that the mind of all sentient beings is the mind.

original: de'i dkyil du gnas pas na sems can kun gyi yid @97b la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i dkyil du gnas pas na sems can kun gyi yid @97b la gnas te /
translated: Since it abides in the middle of that, it abides in the minds of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: That itself is the Bhagavān.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na de dag sems ni mnyam nyid son te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na de dag sems ni mnyam nyid son te /
translated: For that very reason, “it is the equality of their minds.”

original: sems can de dag gi sems ni mnyam pa nyid de dag sems dang mnyam nyid de /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems ni mnyam pa nyid de dag sems dang mnyam nyid de /
translated: The minds of those sentient beings are the equality of their minds.

original: de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
translated: It is the suchness, emptiness.

original: de ltar yang shes rab brgyad stong ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang shes rab brgyad stong ba las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines:

original: gang so so'i skye bo'i de bzhin nyid dang / gang nyan thos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gang rang sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gang byang chub sems dpa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi da bzhin nyid rnams ni de bzhin nyid gcig kho na'o zhes gsungs pa de ltar byas nas sems can kun gyi sems kyi de bzhin dang /
analyzed: gang so so'i skye bo'i de bzhin nyid dang / gang nyan thos kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gang rang sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid dang / gang byang chub sems dpa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi da bzhin nyid rnams ni de bzhin nyid gcig kho na'o zhes gsungs pa de ltar byas nas sems can kun gyi sems kyi de bzhin dang /
translated: The suchness of the minds of all sentient beings,

original: de dag mnyam pa nyid du son par thob pa de ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de dag mnyam pa nyid du son par thob pa de ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: which is attained by reaching their sameness, is suchness.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sems can kun yid tshim par byed //
analyzed: sems can kun yid tshim par byed //
translated: it satisfies the minds of all sentient beings.

original: ces te // sems can de dag nyid phyin ci log las 'das pas bde ba chen po'i ye shes bskyed pa nyid kyis sems can kun gyi yid tshim par byed ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces te // sems can de dag nyid phyin ci log las 'das pas bde ba chen po'i ye shes bskyed pa nyid kyis sems can kun gyi yid tshim par byed ces gsungs so //
translated: Because those sentient beings have transcended error, it generates the gnosis of great bliss, and thus it is said to satisfy the minds of all sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /🔽sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na / sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: it delights the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi yid dga' ba ni thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi yid dga' ba ni thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The delight of all sentient beings is the undefiled bliss of all Tathagatas.

original: ngo bo lhag par chags pas bskyod pas g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad bdag nyid kho na'o zhes yid kyi 'du byed kyi dbye bas lhag par chags pa kho nas rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo lhag par chags pas bskyod pas g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad bdag nyid kho na'o zhes yid kyi 'du byed kyi dbye bas lhag par chags pa kho nas rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: By the division of mental activity, it is engaged in by attachment alone, thinking that all things, moving and unmoving, are just one's own self, moved by the excessive attachment to the essence.

original: grub pa'i mtha' la 'khrul pa med //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' la 'khrul pa med //
translated: There is no error in the tenets.

original: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: All mistakes are completely abandoned.

original: don gsum the tshom med pa'i blo //
analyzed: don gsum the tshom med pa'i blo //
translated: The mind without doubt about the three topics,🔽The object of all, the self of the three qualities.

original: kun don yon tan gsum gyi bdag / ces pa ni de la grub pa'i mtha' la 'khrul pa med ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: kun don yon tan gsum gyi bdag / ces pa ni de la grub pa'i mtha' la 'khrul pa med ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: Here, the absence of error in the tenets is the tenets.

original: brtsams pa'i mtha' de la 'khrul ba med cing ma nges pa'i blo gros bral ba gang yin pa de ni grub pa'i mtha' la 'khrul pa med pa ni de nyid do //
analyzed: brtsams pa'i mtha' de la 'khrul ba med cing ma nges pa'i blo gros bral ba gang yin pa de ni grub pa'i mtha' la 'khrul pa med pa ni de nyid do //
translated: That which is without error and free from uncertain understanding regarding the conclusion of the composition is the absence of error in the tenets.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: all mistakes are completely abandoned.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus,

original: don gyi rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin ji ltar gnas pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the thorough knowledge of the nature of the object as it is.🔽Again,

original: yang / don gsum the tshom med pa'i blo //
analyzed: yang / don gsum the tshom med pa'i blo //
translated: the mind that is without doubt about the three objects.

original: zhes pa la the tshom med pa'i blo dang gang ldan pa de ni the tshom med pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la the tshom med pa'i blo dang gang ldan pa de ni the tshom med pa'i blo ste /
translated: He who has the mind that is without doubt is the one who is without doubt.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grub pa'i mtha' yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i grub pa'i mtha' yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the thorough knowledge of the mundane and supramundane philosophies.

original: don gsum ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi don te /
analyzed: don gsum ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi don te /
translated: The three objects are the past, future, and present objects.

original: @98a * // de'i rang bzhin yang 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: @98a * // de'i rang bzhin yang 'jam dpal lo //
translated: And his nature is also Mañjuśrī.

original: kun don ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun don ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The universal object is the nature of the moving and unmoving things.

original: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid ni snying stobs dang rngul dang / mun pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid ni snying stobs dang rngul dang / mun pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the three qualities is the entry into courage, sweat, and darkness.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: snying stobs dang rngul dang mun pa yang ;
analyzed: snying stobs dang rngul dang mun pa yang ;
translated: Courage, sweat, and darkness

original: / gang phyir sems can don du gyur //
analyzed: / gang phyir sems can don du gyur //
translated: are for the sake of the sentient beings.

original: de phyir kun du bzang po'i bdag / byang chub spyod pa ji bzhin 'gro //
analyzed: de phyir kun du bzang po'i bdag / byang chub spyod pa ji bzhin 'gro //
translated: one goes just as the bodhisattva deeds.

original: zhes so // phung po lnga don dus gsum du //
analyzed: zhes so // phung po lnga don dus gsum du //
translated: The five aggregates are the meaning of the three times.

original: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed /
analyzed: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed /
translated: All moments are distinguished.

original: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs byang chub //
translated: In one moment, there is perfect enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang //🔽zhes pa ni de la phung po lnga don dus gsum du ni phung po lnga rnams kyi don ni dus gsum gyi rnam grangs kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang // zhes pa ni de la phung po lnga don dus gsum du ni phung po lnga rnams kyi don ni dus gsum gyi rnam grangs kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: The nature of all buddhas is held.🔽The five aggregates are the meaning of the three times because the meaning of the five aggregates is the nature of the enumeration of the three times.

original: phung po lnga don dus gsum nyid //
analyzed: phung po lnga don dus gsum nyid //
translated: Therefore, the five aggregates are the three times.

original: ces so // de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Abhidharma:

original: 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
analyzed: 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
translated: Those conditioned phenomena

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga //
translated: are the five aggregates, such as form.

original: de dag nyid dus gtam bzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas bzhi dang bcas //
analyzed: de dag nyid dus gtam bzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas bzhi dang bcas //
translated: They are the four times, along with the four definite extrications.

original: gang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
translated: Those that are contaminated and appropriated

original: phung po 'ang de dag 'thab bcas dang // sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha bcas srid pa 'ang de dag yin //
analyzed: phung po 'ang de dag 'thab bcas dang // sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha bcas srid pa 'ang de dag yin //
translated: The origin of suffering, the world, and existence together with the gods.

original: zhes so // skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed ni rgyu'i gnas skabs na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge pa'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags shing thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i thabs dang shes rab kyi chos
analyzed: zhes so // skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed ni rgyu'i gnas skabs na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge pa'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags shing thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i thabs dang shes rab kyi chos
translated: All moments are distinguished by the bodhisattva who has accumulated the roots of virtue of the perfections such as generosity in the causal period, and who has the Dharma of method and wisdom arisen from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: thams cad rig pas na /
analyzed: thams cad rig pas na /
translated: Because he knows all dharmas,

original: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed //
analyzed: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed //
translated: all moments are distinguished.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su ni //
translated: In the resultant period,

original: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub ste /
analyzed: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub ste /
translated: enlightenment is in one moment.

original: skad cig kyang de yin la gcig kyang de yin pas skad cig gcig go //
analyzed: skad cig kyang de yin la gcig kyang de yin pas skad cig gcig go //
translated: It is a moment and also one, so it is one moment.

original: gang gis skad cig ma gcig kho na la zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kun du bzang po zhes bya ba mngon du byed pa de ni skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gang gis skad cig ma gcig kho na la zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kun du bzang po zhes bya ba mngon du byed pa de ni skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas so //
translated: He who actualizes the wisdom of exhaustion and the wisdom of non-arising in just one instant is called the “good one,” and is a perfect buddha in one instant.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang ni dus gsum du gnas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'di kho na ste /🔽'di ltar / skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang ni dus gsum du gnas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin 'di kho na ste / 'di ltar / skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
translated: He bears the nature of all buddhas means that this very [wisdom] is the nature of all buddhas abiding in the three times.🔽Thus it is said:

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Enlightenment is perfected in one instant.

original: de 'dzin pas sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang ngo //
translated: By upholding that, he bears the nature of all buddhas.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad tshogs dang @98b ni ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad tshogs dang @98b ni ;
translated: All buddhas are equal

original: / chos sku 'gro ba'i don spyod pas //
analyzed: / chos sku 'gro ba'i don spyod pas //
translated: In accumulation, dharmakāya, and benefiting beings.🔽They are not equal in lifespan,

original: mnyam pa nyid du sku tshe dang // rigs dang sku bong tshad dag min //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du sku tshe dang // rigs dang sku bong tshad dag min //
translated: Family, body size, and so forth.🔽The bodiless body, the supreme body,

original: zhes so // lus med lus te lus kyi mchog / lus ni bye ba 'phro bar byed //
analyzed: zhes so // lus med lus te lus kyi mchog / lus ni bye ba 'phro bar byed //
translated: Emanates billions of bodies.

original: gzugs rnams ma lus ston pa po //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma lus ston pa po //
translated: The one who displays all forms,

original: nor bu chen po rin chen tog / ces pa ni de la lus med lus te ni lus yod pa ma yin pa ni lus med de /
analyzed: nor bu chen po rin chen tog / ces pa ni de la lus med lus te ni lus yod pa ma yin pa ni lus med de /
translated: The great jewel, the crest jewel,🔽means that it is a bodyless body, a body that does not exist.

original: med pa'i lus dang gang ldan pa de lus med lus te /
analyzed: med pa'i lus dang gang ldan pa de lus med lus te /
translated: It is a bodyless body because it is endowed with a non-existent body.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of the expanse of reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na lus kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na lus kyi mchog ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the supreme body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i sku'i nang na mchog ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa'i sku'i nang na mchog ste /
translated: It is supreme among the bodies of the enjoyment body and so forth.

original: rab ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab ces pa'i don to //
translated: It has the meaning of excellent.

original: lus rnams te sku bye ba ni lus bye ba grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnams te sku bye ba ni lus bye ba grangs med pa'o //
translated: It is the body of ten million bodies, the body of ten million bodies.🔽It is the emanator of bodies.🔽It is the emanator of ten million bodies because it causes them to go,

original: de rnams 'gro bar byed pa ste /🔽'phro bar byed pas na lus ni bye ba 'phro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'gro bar byed pa ste / 'phro bar byed pas na lus ni bye ba 'phro bar byed pa'o //
translated: it causes them to emanate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /🔽gzugs rnams ma lus ston pa po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na / gzugs rnams ma lus ston pa po //
translated: For that very reason,🔽it is the demonstrator of all forms.

original: zhes te / ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rnams la yang dag par ston pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de gzugs rnams ma lus ston pa po ste /
analyzed: zhes te / ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rnams la yang dag par ston pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de gzugs rnams ma lus ston pa po ste /
translated: It is the demonstrator of all forms because it is endowed with the method of demonstrating to those who are disciplined by all forms without exception.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Bhagavat.🔽Ratna-ketu means jewel-banner.

original: rin chen tog ni 'gro ba thams cad chags par byed pa'i don gyis rin chen no //🔽rin chen des mtshan pa'i tog go //
analyzed: rin chen tog ni 'gro ba thams cad chags par byed pa'i don gyis rin chen no // rin chen des mtshan pa'i tog go //
translated: The jewel is the one who delights all migrating beings.

original: de nyid phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de nyid phyag rgya ste /
translated: The banner is the one who is marked with that jewel.🔽He is the seal.

original: de 'dzin pa yang bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa yang bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The one who holds that is the Bhagavat.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir na rin chen tog ni 'jam dpal zhes so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir na rin chen tog ni 'jam dpal zhes so //
translated: The Bhagavat is Mañjuśrī because of the perfection of generosity, since all wishes are fulfilled, and because of the application of all tathāgatas to the perfection of generosity.

original: da ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin du yang bcom ldan 'das de bstan pa nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin du yang bcom ldan 'das de bstan pa nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the Bhagavat is also the nature of Ratnasaṃbhava, he says the summary:

original: nor bu chen po zhes te /
analyzed: nor bu chen po zhes te /
translated: mahā-maṇi means great jewel.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtha' yas pa nyid kyis 'di ltar gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtha' yas pa nyid kyis 'di ltar gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Since all tathāgatas are infinite, it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa nor bu chen po las byung ba'i phyir na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa nor bu chen po las byung ba'i phyir na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: Since the infinite tathagatas arise from the great jewel, it is the gnosis of equality.

original: des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams rang gi phyag rgyas khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal po chen por dbang bskur ba sbyin par byed pas na de'i phyir na nor bu chen po zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams rang gi phyag rgyas khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal po chen por dbang bskur ba sbyin par byed pas na de'i phyir na nor bu chen po zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since that also bestows the empowerment of the great Dharma king of the three realms with one's own seal to all tathagatas who have fully awakened, therefore it is called the great jewel.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal nyid do //🔽de nas da ni nam mkha'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal phyogs bcu mtha' @99a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal nyid do // de nas da ni nam mkha'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal phyogs bcu mtha' @99a * //
translated: It is the bhagavat Manjushri himself.

original: yas 'byam klas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs nas sems can gyi khams rnams kyi ser sna bcom ste /
analyzed: yas 'byam klas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs nas sems can gyi khams rnams kyi ser sna bcom ste /
translated: Now, the bhagavat Manjushri, abiding in the samadhi of Akashagarbha, having gone to the buddhafields of the ten directions, infinite and limitless, having conquered the realms of sentient beings' miserliness,

original: rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas dag par byas nas gang mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig brgya rtsa bzhi de rnams rtag pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye bas rnam pa lngar bgos te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas dag par byas nas gang mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig brgya rtsa bzhi de rnams rtag pa la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye bas rnam pa lngar bgos te /
translated: Having purified them by way of one’s own liberation, the syllables of the mantra words of the name, 1,124 in number, are divided into five by way of the divisions of the families of Akṣobhya and so forth.

original: rigs re ra las nyi shu rtsa re rer mtshan pa rnams rjas su sbyar te /
analyzed: rigs re ra las nyi shu rtsa re rer mtshan pa rnams rjas su sbyar te /
translated: Each family has twenty-two syllables, which are applied to the individual families.

original: de rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas te /
translated: They also perform the deeds of the buddhas.

original: yang slar log nas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyi rol 'khor lo bzhi pa la rang rang gi kha dog gis kha dog bsgyur ba'i yi ge rnams su gyur te /🔽ji ltar go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yang slar log nas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyi rol 'khor lo bzhi pa la rang rang gi kha dog gis kha dog bsgyur ba'i yi ge rnams su gyur te / ji ltar go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Then, having returned, they become the syllables that transform the colors of the four wheels outside the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm into their individual colors, and they are arranged in order.

original: de ltar yang gong du gsungs pa'i gzugs rnam pa gsum du bdag nyid dmigs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang gong du gsungs pa'i gzugs rnam pa gsum du bdag nyid dmigs te /
translated: As such, one’s own body is visualized as the three forms mentioned above.

original: sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mos 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa klog pas ni 'og nas gsungs pa'i yon tan cher thob ces man ngag go //
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mos 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa klog pas ni 'og nas gsungs pa'i yon tan cher thob ces man ngag go //
translated: The sons or daughters of good family who practice the mantra path, by reciting the Noble One's Name-Only, will obtain the great qualities mentioned below. This is the instruction.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: There are twenty-four verses.

original: mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge grangs ni brgya rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge grangs ni brgya rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The number of syllables in the mantra of the name is one hundred and four.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes pa las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi bstod pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes pa las mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi bstod pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste dgu pa'o /
translated: From the commentary on the Noble One's Name-Only, called The View of the Meaning of the Secret Mantra Names, this is the ninth chapter, from the perspective of the stage of praise, which is the nature of the wisdom of equality.

original: // / da ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i bstod pa 'di brjod pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa //
analyzed: // / da ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i bstod pa 'di brjod pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa //
translated: Now, from the perspective of the wisdom of purposeful activity, this praise of the Blessed One, the wisdom body of all the Tathagatas, is expressed.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba //
translated: It is to be realized by all the buddhas.🔽

original: sangs rgyas byang chub bla na med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub bla na med //
translated: The enlightenment of the buddhas is the unsurpassed enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: gsang sngags las byung yi ge med //🔽gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa //
analyzed: gsang sngags las byung yi ge med // gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa //
translated: It is the source of the mantras, the syllable-less.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: It is the great mantra, the three families.

original: de la sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba ni dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rtogs par bya zhing shes par bya ba mngon du bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid yin pas sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba ni dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rtogs par bya zhing shes par bya ba mngon du bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid yin pas sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba'o //
translated: As for the enlightenment of the buddhas, it is the enlightenment of all the buddhas of the three times, and it is the very same Bhagavān who is to be realized, known, and actualized.

original: de ltar yang dpal de nyid 'dus pa las gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang dpal de nyid 'dus pa las gsungs pa //
translated: Thus it is said in the Śrī-sarva-tattva-saṃgraha:

original: mngon par byang chub khyed la brten //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub khyed la brten //
translated: Enlightenment is based on you.

original: khyed ni kun gzigs yab yin te //🔽byung dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: khyed ni kun gzigs yab yin te // byung dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yi //
translated: You are the all-seeing father.🔽The tathāgatas of the past and future

original: de bzhin gshegs rnams khyed la brten //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rnams khyed la brten //
translated: are based on you.

original: zhes so // sangs rgyas byang chub ni nyan thos la sogs pa gsum @99b po'i byang chub ni sangs rgyas byang chub po //
analyzed: zhes so // sangs rgyas byang chub ni nyan thos la sogs pa gsum @99b po'i byang chub ni sangs rgyas byang chub po //
translated: As for the enlightenment of the buddhas, the enlightenment of the three vehicles of śrāvakas and so forth is the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: byang chub rnam pa gsum ni ji skad gsungs pa'i nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub rnam pa gsum ni ji skad gsungs pa'i nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnams so //
translated: The three kinds of enlightenment are the enlightenment of the disciples, the enlightenment of the Solitary Buddhas, and the perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam pa gsum yin yang de nyid bla na med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum yin yang de nyid bla na med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Although there are three kinds, it is the highest.

original: 'di las bla na med pas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las bla na med pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is the highest because there is nothing higher than it.

original: gsang sngags las byung ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir na gsang sngags 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags las byung ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir na gsang sngags 'byung ba ste /
translated: The source of the mantra is the source of the mundane and supramundane mantras, because it is the very source of their origination.

original: byed rgyu zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: byed rgyu zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “source” is “cause.”

original: yi ge med ni gang la brjod par bya ba dang / brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yi ge rnams med pa de ni yi ge rnams med pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge med ni gang la brjod par bya ba dang / brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yi ge rnams med pa de ni yi ge rnams med pa ste /
translated: The absence of syllables is that which is without syllables, which have the nature of the expressed and the expresser.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the absence of syllables because it has the nature of the ultimate realm.

original: gsang sngags chen po rags gsum pa ni sngags kyang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas gsang sngags chen po ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags chen po rags gsum pa ni sngags kyang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas gsang sngags chen po ste /
translated: The great mantra of three lineages is the great mantra itself, thus it is the great mantra.

original: rtag pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / snang ba mtha' yas te rigs gsum po rnams ni rigs gsum mo ;
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / snang ba mtha' yas te rigs gsum po rnams ni rigs gsum mo ;
translated: The three lineages are the lineages of Akshobhya, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: / gsang sngags chen po'i bdag nyid rigs gsum dang gang ldan pa de ni gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa ste /
analyzed: / gsang sngags chen po'i bdag nyid rigs gsum dang gang ldan pa de ni gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa ste /
translated: The one who possesses the three lineages, the nature of the great mantra, is the great mantra of three lineages,

original: sku gsung thugs nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because his body, speech, and mind are equal to space.

original: de yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
analyzed: de yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
translated: Moreover, the glorious Guhyasamaja states:

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje nam mkha'i tshul nges par sbyor zhing ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do zhes so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje nam mkha'i tshul nges par sbyor zhing ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do zhes so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahasattva, having united the method of the space of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathagatas, uttered this utterance.

original: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //
analyzed: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //
translated: The generator of all the meanings of mantra

original: thig le chen po yi ge med //
analyzed: thig le chen po yi ge med //
translated: is the great bindu, without syllables.

original: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
analyzed: stong pa chen po yi ge lnga //
translated: The great emptiness is the five syllables.🔽The empty drop is the six syllables.

original: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces pa ni de la gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags thams cad kyi don te /
analyzed: thig le stong pa yi ge drug / ces pa ni de la gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags thams cad kyi don te /
translated: The Bhagavān is the one who generates all the meanings of the secret mantra, all the worldly and transcendent secret mantras.

original: de skyed pa ni 'byin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de skyed pa ni 'byin par byed pa ste /
translated: He generates them, he emits them.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He himself is the Bhagavān.

original: thig le chen po ni dang po'i yi ge aa nas ha la thug pa'i bar du dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams ni thig le chen po zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: thig le chen po ni dang po'i yi ge aa nas ha la thug pa'i bar du dbyangs dang gsal byed rnams ni thig le chen po zhes gsungs te ;
translated: The great drop is the vowels and consonants from the first syllable a to ha. They are called the great drop.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
translated: He himself is the Bhagavān.

original: yi ge med ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge med ni don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The syllable-less is because of the nature of the ultimate.

original: stong pa chen po ni stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa chen po ni stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The great emptiness is because of the nature of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: yi ge lnga ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i yi ge 'bru a'a aom h'um hr'i ;
analyzed: yi ge lnga ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i yi ge 'bru a'a aom h'um hr'i ;
translated: The five syllables are the syllables of permanence and so forth, a āṃ hūṃ hrīḥ.

original: aa ; zhes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir na yi ge aa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: aa ; zhes pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir na yi ge aa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the nature of a ā, he is called the syllable a.

original: @100a * // thig le stong pa zhes pa la thig le ni sa bon gyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: @100a * // thig le stong pa zhes pa la thig le ni sa bon gyi yi ge'o //
translated: The “empty bindu” is the seed syllable.

original: de la don dam par mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don dam par mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it is ultimately unobservable by nature.

original: yi ge drug ni aom wa' g'i shva ri mum zhes te yi ge drug pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge drug ni aom wa' g'i shva ri mum zhes te yi ge drug pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The “six syllables” are the six syllables of the six-syllable mantra, oṃ vāgīśvari muṃ.

original: rnam pa kun gyi rnam pa med //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi rnam pa med //
translated: It is “without aspects of any kind.”

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
translated: It is “endowed with the bindu of a half-half of sixteen.”

original: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das //
analyzed: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das //
translated: It is “beyond the enumeration of the partless.”

original: bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo can //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo can //
translated: It is “the peak of the four meditative concentrations.”🔽It is “without aspects of any kind” because it is beyond and does not have the aspects of all those phenomena, such as the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: zhes pa ni de la rnam pa kun gyi rnam pa med ni rnam pa kun ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa'i chos de rnams kun gang yin pa las 'das shing med pa'i rnam pa'i yan lag dang gang ldan pa de de🔽lar gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la rnam pa kun gyi rnam pa med ni rnam pa kun ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa'i chos de rnams kun gang yin pa las 'das shing med pa'i rnam pa'i yan lag dang gang ldan pa de de lar gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be endowed with the part of that aspect.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sum brgya pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sum brgya pa las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom in Three Hundred Lines:

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pas de bzhin gshegs par blta'am /
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pas de bzhin gshegs par blta'am /
translated: Should the Tathāgata be viewed in terms of the perfection of the major and minor marks?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan phun sum tshogs pas de bzhin gshegs par blta bar bya ba 'di ni ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan phun sum tshogs pas de bzhin gshegs par blta bar bya ba 'di ni ma lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, the Tathāgata should not be viewed in terms of the perfection of the major and minor marks.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de nyid mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ma lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: gang mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de nyid mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ma lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because the Tathāgata has said that whatever is the perfection of the major and minor marks is not the perfection of the major and minor marks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan par rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan par rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor ji srid ji srid du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de srid du brdzun no //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji srid ji srid du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de srid du brdzun no //
translated: “Subhūti, as long as there is the perfection of the major and minor marks, there is falsity.

original: ji srid du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa de srid du brdzun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: ji srid du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa de srid du brdzun pa ma lags so //
translated: As long as there is not the perfection of the major and minor marks, there is not falsity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan ma yin par blta bar bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan ma yin par blta bar bya'o zhes te /
translated: One should view the Tathāgata as a sign of that.

original: de kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the conventional and the ultimate.”

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can //
translated: The sixteen half-moons, the possessor of the bindu,

original: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das //
analyzed: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das //
translated: beyond the calculation of the formless.

original: bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo can ni de bdag gi bla ma'i lung yin pa'i phyir na tshig rkang gsum gyi don bdag gis ma bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo can ni de bdag gi bla ma'i lung yin pa'i phyir na tshig rkang gsum gyi don bdag gis ma bshad do //
translated: The peak of the four dhyanas, this is the oral instruction of my guru. Therefore, I will not explain the meaning of the three lines.

original: de'i phyir na bdag cag gi bla mas ji lta ba bzhin du bdag la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bdag cag gi bla mas ji lta ba bzhin du bdag la gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, my guru taught me exactly as it is.

original: sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa las thams cad so sor rtogs pa dad pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i slob ma rnams dus ring por mnyes par byed pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par las sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par byang chub pa'i bla ma'i man ngag
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa las thams cad so sor rtogs pa dad pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i slob ma rnams dus ring por mnyes par byed pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par las sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par byang chub pa'i bla ma'i man ngag
translated: For those disciples who are endowed with faith and the realization of all the practices of mantra conduct, through the special intention of pleasing for a long time, the oral instruction of the guru’s manifest awakening of the Magical Net

original: snyan khung nas snyan khung du brgyud pa rab tu bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: snyan khung nas snyan khung du brgyud pa rab tu bstan par bya'o //
translated: will be revealed from ear to ear.

original: de'i phyir de'i sbyor ba 'tsham de'i sbyor ba 'tshams pa bgoms pas @100b /'jigs pas t'i k'a las 'di rnam par ma spros so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sbyor ba 'tsham de'i sbyor ba 'tshams pa bgoms pas @100b /'jigs pas t'i k'a las 'di rnam par ma spros so //
translated: Therefore, I will not elaborate on this from the perspective of fear of being too wordy.

original: bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing //
analyzed: bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing //
translated: He knows all the branches of meditation,

original: ting 'dzin rigs dang rgyud 'chang ba //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rigs dang rgyud 'chang ba //
translated: and holds the lineage and continuity of samadhi.🔽He is the body of samadhi, the supreme body,

original: ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog / longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal //
analyzed: ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog / longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal //
translated: the king of all the sambhogakaya.

original: zhes pa ni de la bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing ni bsam gtan kun ni bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la bsam gtan yan lag kun shes shing ni bsam gtan kun ni bzhi rnams te /
translated: He knows all the branches of meditation. The four meditations are

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba zhes pa rnams las so //🔽de la rtog pa dang bcas /🔽dpyod pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba zhes pa rnams las so // de la rtog pa dang bcas / dpyod pa dang bcas /
translated: contemplation, discernment, joy, and bliss.🔽The first meditation has contemplation and discernment,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: and the joy and bliss that arise from seclusion.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa spangs pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second meditation is free from contemplation and discernment.

original: dga' ba yang med cing btang snyoms dang dran pa yang dag par ldan pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba yang med cing btang snyoms dang dran pa yang dag par ldan pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
translated: The third meditation is free from joy, but has equanimity and mindfulness.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth meditation is free from both pain and pleasure, and has pure equanimity and mindfulness.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag gi yan lag ste cha shas 'di rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag gi yan lag ste cha shas 'di rnams so //
translated: These are the members, the parts of the four meditations.

original: lde shes na ni mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: lde shes na ni mkhas pa ste /
translated: One who knows them is wise,

original: bsam gtan de rab tu 'byed pa la yang sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan de rab tu 'byed pa la yang sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: because he is also engaged in the analysis of those meditations.

original: de la mos pa'i sems can kun du bzang po'i don yin no //
analyzed: de la mos pa'i sems can kun du bzang po'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of universal good is the mental orientation to that.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa mngon du byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa mngon du byed de /
translated: The bodhisattvas manifest the first meditation, etc.

original: sems can gyi don gyis gnas pas na de'i dbang gis skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyis gnas pas na de'i dbang gis skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but they do not take rebirth under the influence of those meditations, because they abide for the sake of beings.

original: dre bzhin du 'og nas bshad pa las kyang lha cho ring por mi skye bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: dre bzhin du 'og nas bshad pa las kyang lha cho ring por mi skye bar shes pa ste /
translated: And it should be understood that they do not take rebirth among the longlived gods, as will be explained later.

original: de rnams su skye ba la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams su skye ba la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have attained mastery over rebirth in those realms.

original: ting 'dzin rigs dang rgyud 'chang ba ni ting nge 'dzin rnams ni de yang mchog tu dge ba la rtse gcig pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir na bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rigs dang rgyud 'chang ba ni ting nge 'dzin rnams ni de yang mchog tu dge ba la rtse gcig pa'i rnam par bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir na bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The first concentration and so on are characterized by that.

original: go rims bzhin du rang gi ming dang don gyi rjes su dran pa'i rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med de /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rang gi ming dang don gyi rjes su dran pa'i rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med de /
translated: The divisions of the recollection of their names and meanings are immeasurable, in accordance with their order.

original: de bas na de rnams kyi rigs dang rgyud ni gdon mi za bar nyan thos la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de rnams kyi rigs dang rgyud ni gdon mi za bar nyan thos la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, their lineage and stream are definitely the sravakas and so on.

original: de 'dzin pas na ting 'dzin rigs dang rgyud 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na ting 'dzin rigs dang rgyud 'chang ba'o //
translated: Since he holds them, he is the holder of the lineage and stream of samadhis.🔽The one with the body of samadhi, the supreme body, is the Bhagavat.

original: ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog ni ting nge 'dzin gyi lus ni lus kyi sku'o //
analyzed: ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog ni ting nge 'dzin gyi lus ni lus kyi sku'o //
translated: The body of samadhi is the body of the Buddha.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sprul pa la sogs pa'i lus thams cad las mchog dang rab yin pas na ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sprul pa la sogs pa'i lus thams cad las mchog dang rab yin pas na ting 'dzin lus can lus kyi mchog ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is the one with the body of samadhi, the supreme body, because he is supreme and excellent among all bodies, such as emanation bodies.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He himself is the Bhagavat.

original: longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal ni longs spyod @101a * //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal ni longs spyod @101a * //
translated: The king of all the sambhogakayas is the Bhagavat Manjushri, who has become all the sambhogakayas.

original: rdzogs pa'i sku thams cad du gyur pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'khor thams cad kyi nang na che ba'i bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa bden pa'i don 'bras bu dang bcas pa sna tshogs pa bsam du med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sku thams cad du gyur pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'khor thams cad kyi nang na che ba'i bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa bden pa'i don 'bras bu dang bcas pa sna tshogs pa bsam du med pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa'
translated: He is the one who has perfected the greatness of being in the midst of all retinues, the inconceivable supramundane bodhisattva who teaches the various meanings of the truth together with their results.

original: thams cad dga' ba'i rgyu rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir na bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad dga' ba'i rgyu rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir na bstan to //
translated: He is taught because he is the cause of the joy of all.

original: de 'ang de nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas mdzes shing 'bar bas na longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal lo //
analyzed: de 'ang de nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas mdzes shing 'bar bas na longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal lo //
translated: Moreover, he is the king of all the sambhogakayas because he is beautiful and blazing through the teaching of thatness.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: As is said:

original: bdag gi sbyor ba 'jig rten las 'das bsam gyis mi khyab legs mdzad legs pa'i 'bru //
analyzed: bdag gi sbyor ba 'jig rten las 'das bsam gyis mi khyab legs mdzad legs pa'i 'bru //
translated: My inconceivable supramundane mind is the seed of goodness.

original: blo chen rnams kyi dga' ba'i rgyu ni 'khor ba'i nang du sna tshogs rab ston cing //
analyzed: blo chen rnams kyi dga' ba'i rgyu ni 'khor ba'i nang du sna tshogs rab ston cing //
translated: The cause of the joy of the wise is the various teachings in the midst of samsara.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi sgra chen rtag tu 'jig rten khams rnams kun dur rab 'phro ba //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi sgra chen rtag tu 'jig rten khams rnams kun dur rab 'phro ba //
translated: The great sound of the holy Dharma always spreads in all the worlds.

original: sangs rgyas chos kyi rgyal srid che la bzhugs pa de la 'dir ni phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos kyi rgyal srid che la bzhugs pa de la 'dir ni phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to him who dwells in the great kingdom of the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: zhes so // sprul pa'i sku ste sku yi mchog / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba //
analyzed: zhes so // sprul pa'i sku ste sku yi mchog / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba //
translated: The emanation body, the supreme body, holds the lineage of the emanation of the Buddha.

original: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed //
analyzed: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed //
translated: It sends forth various emanations in the ten directions.

original: ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
analyzed: ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
translated: It acts for the welfare of living beings just as they are.

original: zhes pa ni de la sprul pa'i sku ste sku'i mchog ni sprul pa'i bdag nyid kyi sku ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la sprul pa'i sku ste sku'i mchog ni sprul pa'i bdag nyid kyi sku ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The emanation body, the supreme body, the body of the nature of emanation is the emanation body.

original: de 'ang gzhan 'jig rten pa'i sprul pa rnams kyi nang na rab kyi phyir na sku'i mchog ces gsungs so ;
analyzed: de 'ang gzhan 'jig rten pa'i sprul pa rnams kyi nang na rab kyi phyir na sku'i mchog ces gsungs so ;
translated: And because it is the best of all other worldly emanations, it is called the supreme body.

original: / de ltar yang gsungs ba /
analyzed: / de ltar yang gsungs ba /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sems can rnams kyi smin pa'i rgyu phyir la lar 'bar pa'i me bzhin gang snang zhing //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi smin pa'i rgyu phyir la lar 'bar pa'i me bzhin gang snang zhing //
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings, it appears in some places like a blazing fire.

original: la lar yang ni rdzogs byang chub dang chos kyi 'khor lo rab bzhir gang snang ba //
analyzed: la lar yang ni rdzogs byang chub dang chos kyi 'khor lo rab bzhir gang snang ba //
translated: And to some, the perfect enlightenment and the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: rnam pa du mar 'jug cing srid gsum rab 'dzin sna tshogs thabs kyis 'joms mdzad pa //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar 'jug cing srid gsum rab 'dzin sna tshogs thabs kyis 'joms mdzad pa //
translated: Having entered into many forms, he holds the three worlds, and with various methods, he conquers.

original: thub pa rnams kyi don chen phyogs bcur rjes mngon sprul sku de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thub pa rnams kyi don chen phyogs bcur rjes mngon sprul sku de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to that emanation body of the sages, whose great purpose is pursued in the ten directions.

original: zhes so // sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba ni dus gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa de rnams kyi rgyud ni rim pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba ni dus gsum na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa de rnams kyi rgyud ni rim pa ste /
translated: The bearer of the continuum of the emanations of the buddhas is the continuum of the emanations of the buddhas existing in the three times.

original: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud do //
translated: The continuum of the emanations of the buddhas.

original: de 'dzin pas na sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyud 'chang ba ste /
translated: Because he holds that, he is the bearer of the continuum of the emanations of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not interrupt the lineage of all tathāgatas.

original: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs pa ni phyogs bcu po rnams su rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa'i sprul pa'i cho 'phrul dang gang ldan pa de phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs pa ni phyogs bcu po rnams su rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa'i sprul pa'i cho 'phrul dang gang ldan pa de phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed pa'o //
translated: He who has the various emanations in the ten directions is the one who sends forth the various emanations in the ten directions, because he has the magical emanation of various different forms in the ten directions.

original: @101b de nyid kyi phyir na ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa ste //
analyzed: @101b de nyid kyi phyir na ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa ste //
translated: Therefore, he acts for the welfare of the world in the proper way.

original: ji bzhin phyin ci ma log par don bstan pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba'i don byed pas na ji bzhin 'gro ba'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji bzhin phyin ci ma log par don bstan pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba'i don byed pas na ji bzhin 'gro ba'i byed pa'o //
translated: He acts for the welfare of the world in the proper way, because he teaches the meaning without error.

original: lha yi dbang po lha yi lha //
analyzed: lha yi dbang po lha yi lha //
translated: He is the lord of the gods, the god of gods,

original: lha min dbang po lha min bdag /'chi med dbang po lha yi bla //
analyzed: lha min dbang po lha min bdag /'chi med dbang po lha yi bla //
translated: the lord of the demigods, the master of the demigods, the lord of the immortals, the god of gods,

original: 'joms byed 'joms byed dbang phyug po ;
analyzed: 'joms byed 'joms byed dbang phyug po ;
translated: the destroyer, the destroyer of the lord, the lord of lords.

original: / zhes pa ni de la lha'i dbang po ni khyab 'jug gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽lha'i lha ni tshangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni de la lha'i dbang po ni khyab 'jug gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro // lha'i lha ni tshangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, he is the lord of the gods because he is of the nature of Vishnu.🔽He is the god of gods because he is of the nature of Brahma.

original: lha min dbang po ni rnam par snang byed 'be le'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: lha min dbang po ni rnam par snang byed 'be le'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: He is the lord of the demigods because he has the form of the demigod Vritra.

original: lha min bdag ni gza' r'a hu la'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lha min bdag ni gza' r'a hu la'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The asura is Rahu by nature.

original: 'chi med dbang po ni grong khyer 'jig gi gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi med dbang po ni grong khyer 'jig gi gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The lord of immortality is the form of Rahu.

original: lha'i bla ni gza' phur bu'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i bla ni gza' phur bu'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The lord of the gods is the form of the planet Jupiter.

original: 'joms byed ni tshogs bdag gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'joms byed ni tshogs bdag gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The destroyer is the nature of Ganapati.

original: 'joms byed dbang phyug ni ma h'a de wa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'joms byed dbang phyug ni ma h'a de wa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The lord of the destroyer is the nature of Mahadeva.

original: lha'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid la mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid la mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The lords of the gods and so forth should praise the Bhagavat himself.

original: srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba //
analyzed: srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba //
translated: He who has crossed the desert of existence,

original: ston pa gcig po 'gro pa'i bla //
analyzed: ston pa gcig po 'gro pa'i bla //
translated: the sole teacher, the lord of beings,

original: 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
translated: renowned in the ten directions of the world,

original: chos kyi sbyin bdag che ba po //🔽zhes pa ni de la srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba ni srid pa ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin bdag che ba po // zhes pa ni de la srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba ni srid pa ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: the great lord of the gift of Dharma.🔽Here, the desert of existence is samsara.

original: de nyid kyi dgon pa ste brgal dka' ba nyid kyi phyir na srid pa'i dgon pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dgon pa ste brgal dka' ba nyid kyi phyir na srid pa'i dgon pa'o //
translated: It is a desert because it is difficult to cross, thus it is the desert of existence.

original: gang gis srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba de ni srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba de ni srid pa'i dgon pa las brgal ba'o //
translated: He who has crossed the wilderness of existence is the one who has crossed the wilderness of existence.

original: gcig pu ni gnyis su med pa ste //
analyzed: gcig pu ni gnyis su med pa ste //
translated: Alone means without a second.

original: de dang 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no one like him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na ston pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na ston pa zhes pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is the Teacher.

original: ston pa ni gang sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ston par byed pas na ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa ni gang sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ston par byed pas na ston pa yin no //
translated: The Teacher is the one who shows the activity of all sentient beings.

original: de la sems can thams cad kyi ston pa ni khyad par med pa bcom ldan 'das 'dam dpal de nyid de /
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad kyi ston pa ni khyad par med pa bcom ldan 'das 'dam dpal de nyid de /
translated: The Teacher of all sentient beings is the Blessed One, the glorious one, without distinction.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ston par byed pa nyid kyis byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba ston par byed pa nyid kyis byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who shows the activity of all sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ngan song du skyes pa rnam la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yi 'od zer las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bstan pas rab tu dang bar byas te mtho ris la so sor 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: ngan song du skyes pa rnam la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yi 'od zer las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bstan pas rab tu dang bar byas te mtho ris la so sor 'jog par byed do //
translated: even for those born in the lower realms, by showing the body of the Tathagata through the light rays of the Tathagata's body, he causes faith and establishes them in the higher realms.

original: mtho ris su skyes pa rnams la yang skal pa dang mi ldan pa kha cig rnams la gong du gsungs pa'i tshogs bsam pa yongs su dag par byas nas 'khor ba'i bde ba'i las sbyin pa la sogs pa la so sor 'jog @102a * //🔽par byed de //
analyzed: mtho ris su skyes pa rnams la yang skal pa dang mi ldan pa kha cig rnams la gong du gsungs pa'i tshogs bsam pa yongs su dag par byas nas 'khor ba'i bde ba'i las sbyin pa la sogs pa la so sor 'jog @102a * // par byed de //
translated: Even those born in the higher realms, some of whom are unfortunate, are placed in the practices of generosity, etc. for the happiness of cyclic existence, after their thoughts have been purified as previously explained.

original: skal pa dang ldan pa rigs rnams la yang bsam pa rnam pa gnyis kyis nye par ston pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: skal pa dang ldan pa rigs rnams la yang bsam pa rnam pa gnyis kyis nye par ston pa rnams kyis te /
translated: But those of fortunate lineage are taught by the Buddhas through two kinds of thoughts.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kya dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bskrun pa rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kya dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bskrun pa rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Those who have not accumulated the roots of virtue are caused to plant the roots of virtue, and those who have planted the roots of virtue are caused to ripen the roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams ni yongs su grol bar byas te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams ni yongs su grol bar byas te /
translated: Those whose roots of virtue are ripe are caused to be liberated.

original: rigs ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa la so sor 'jog go //
analyzed: rigs ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa la so sor 'jog go //
translated: They are placed in the vehicles of the Disciples, etc. according to their lineage.

original: da ltar ngan song dang mtho ris su skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rigs rnams la bya ba mthun par bsgrub pa'i phyir na de nyid sems can thams cad kyi ston pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da ltar ngan song dang mtho ris su skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rigs rnams la bya ba mthun par bsgrub pa'i phyir na de nyid sems can thams cad kyi ston pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is the teacher of all sentient beings because he acts in a way that is consistent with the good fortune and misfortune of those who are born in the lower realms and the higher realms.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na 'gro ba'i bla ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na 'gro ba'i bla ma ste /
translated: He is the guru of the world because of that.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi bla ma yin pas 'gro ba'i bla ma'o //🔽'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi bla ma yin pas 'gro ba'i bla ma'o // 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
translated: He is the guru of the world because he is the guru of the world.

original: chos kyi sbyin bdag ni phyogs bcu rnams kyi 'jig rten ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten no //🔽phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kyang de yin la rab grags kyang de nyid yin pas 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin bdag ni phyogs bcu rnams kyi 'jig rten ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten no // phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten kyang de yin la rab grags kyang de nyid yin pas 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa ste /
translated: He is the Dharma donor in the world of the ten directions.🔽The world of the ten directions is the world of the ten directions.

original: 'jig rten na phyogs bcur grags pa ste /🔽de rnams la chos kyi sbyin bdag gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na phyogs bcur grags pa ste / de rnams la chos kyi sbyin bdag gang yin pa de /
translated: The world of the ten directions is also famous, so it is the world of the ten directions.

original: 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyogs bcur rab grags pa //
translated: He is famous in the world of the ten directions.🔽He is the Dharma donor to those who are famous in the world of the ten directions.

original: chos kyi sbyin bdag go //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin bdag go //
translated: He is the Dharma donor in the world of the ten directions.

original: de nyid che ba po zhes te ;
analyzed: de nyid che ba po zhes te ;
translated: It is called the “great being”

original: / g-yo bdang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po rnams la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / g-yo bdang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po rnams la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pervades all things, both moving and unmoving.

original: de ltar yang dbal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa /🔽kun du kun nas thams cad du //
analyzed: de ltar yang dbal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa / kun du kun nas thams cad du //
translated: Thus it is said in the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra:🔽In every way, in every respect,

original: bdag nyid rtag tu rnam pa kun //🔽sangs rgyas la sogs brtan g-yo kun //
analyzed: bdag nyid rtag tu rnam pa kun // sangs rgyas la sogs brtan g-yo kun //
translated: I am always in every way🔽The essence of all things,

original: kun gyi dngos por bdag gyur to //🔽zhes so // byams pa'i go cha chas pa ste //
analyzed: kun gyi dngos por bdag gyur to // zhes so // byams pa'i go cha chas pa ste //
translated: both moving and unmoving, such as the buddhas.🔽Wearing the armor of love,

original: snying rje yi ni ya lad bgos //
analyzed: snying rje yi ni ya lad bgos //
translated: clothed in patience,

original: shes rab ral gri mda' gzhu thogs //
analyzed: shes rab ral gri mda' gzhu thogs //
translated: wielding the sword of wisdom and the bow and arrow of energy,

original: nyon mongs mi shes g-yul ngo sel //
