analyzed: nyon mongs mi shes g-yul ngo sel //
translated: he conquers the battle of the afflictions and ignorance.

original: zhes pa ni de la byams pa'i go cha chas pa ste ni /🔽byams pa ni sems can thams cad la bshes dang grogs dang bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa rnams so ;🔽khyams pa des go cha ni byams pa'i go cha gang gis chas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la byams pa'i go cha chas pa ste ni / byams pa ni sems can thams cad la bshes dang grogs dang bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa rnams so ; khyams pa des go cha ni byams pa'i go cha gang gis chas pa ste /
translated: Here, “wearing the armor of love” means🔽that love is the armor with which he is clothed.

original: byams pa'i go cha chas pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i go cha chas pa'o //
translated: He is clothed in the armor of love.

original: snying rje yi ni ya lang bgos ni snying rje ni ji snyed gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje yi ni ya lang bgos ni snying rje ni ji snyed gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The armor of compassion is the compassion that has been taught.

original: de nyid ya lad de snying rje'i ya lad do //
analyzed: de nyid ya lad de snying rje'i ya lad do //
translated: That itself is the armor, the armor of compassion.

original: snying rje'i ya lad de bgos pas bsrung ba gang yin de snying rje'i ya lad @102b bgos so //
analyzed: snying rje'i ya lad de bgos pas bsrung ba gang yin de snying rje'i ya lad @102b bgos so //
translated: The protection by wearing the armor of compassion is the wearing of the armor of compassion.

original: shes rab ral gri mnga' gzhu thogs ni /
analyzed: shes rab ral gri mnga' gzhu thogs ni /
translated: The sword of wisdom, the bow and arrow

original: shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i pu sti'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i pu sti'o //
translated: Wisdom is the bow of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ral gri ni ye shes kyi ral gri'o //
analyzed: ral gri ni ye shes kyi ral gri'o //
translated: The sword is the sword of knowledge.

original: mda' ni sems phra mo yongs su 'bigs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mda' ni sems phra mo yongs su 'bigs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The arrow is the nature of the complete penetration of the subtle mind.

original: gzhu ni rdo rje'i gzhu'o //
analyzed: gzhu ni rdo rje'i gzhu'o //
translated: The bow is the vajra bow.

original: des kyang ci gsung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des kyang ci gsung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does he do with that?

original: byams pa'i go cha chas shing snying rje'i ya lad kyis bsrungs pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa nyon mongs pa'i mi shes pa ni 'dod chags pa'i gti mug go //
analyzed: byams pa'i go cha chas shing snying rje'i ya lad kyis bsrungs pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa nyon mongs pa'i mi shes pa ni 'dod chags pa'i gti mug go //
translated: He is armed with the armor of love, protected by the armor of compassion, and endowed with the seal of wisdom and so forth. The ignorance of the afflictions is the delusion of desire.

original: de nyid g-yul te 'thab mo'o //
analyzed: de nyid g-yul te 'thab mo'o //
translated: That itself is the battle, the fight.

original: de sel zhing spong bas na bcom ldan 'das dngos po de nyon mongs mi shes g-yul ngo sel ba yin no //
analyzed: de sel zhing spong bas na bcom ldan 'das dngos po de nyon mongs mi shes g-yul ngo sel ba yin no //
translated: Since he destroys and abandons that, he is the Bhagavat, the conqueror of the battle of the afflictions and ignorance.

original: man ngag ni 'di'o //
analyzed: man ngag ni 'di'o //
translated: This is the instruction.

original: mdog dmar ba dang phyag bzhi par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdog dmar ba dang phyag bzhi par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know him as red in color and having four arms.

original: dpa' bo bdud dgra bdud 'dul ba //
analyzed: dpa' bo bdud dgra bdud 'dul ba //
translated: The hero, the enemy of Mara, the subjugator of Mara,

original: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed //
translated: the remover of the fear of the four Maras,

original: bdud kyi dpung rnams pham par byed //
analyzed: bdud kyi dpung rnams pham par byed //
translated: the one who defeats the armies of Mara,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten 'dren //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten 'dren //
translated: the perfect Buddha, the guide of the world.

original: zhes pa ni de la bdud dgra ni bdud rnams te bgegs kyi dgra ste bdud dgra'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la bdud dgra ni bdud rnams te bgegs kyi dgra ste bdud dgra'o //
translated: Here, the enemy of Mara is Mara, the enemy of obstacles, the enemy of Mara.

original: de nyid bdud 'dul zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid bdud 'dul zhes pa ste /
translated: That very one is the subjugator of Mara,

original: rdo rje gdan la bzhugs nas bdud mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams 'joms pas na bdud 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gdan la bzhugs nas bdud mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams 'joms pas na bdud 'dul ba'o //
translated: sitting on the vajra seat, conquering Mara and adverse factors, he is the subjugator of Mara.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na dpa' po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na dpa' po ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is the hero,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan rnams kyis zil mi non pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan rnams kyis zil mi non pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is not overwhelmed by other adverse factors.

original: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed ni bdud rnams ni bdud bzhi'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed ni bdud rnams ni bdud bzhi'o //
translated: The remover of the fear of the four Maras, the Maras are the four Maras.

original: de rnams 'jigs pa ni bdud bzhi 'jigs so //
analyzed: de rnams 'jigs pa ni bdud bzhi 'jigs so //
translated: The fear of those is the fear of the four demons.

original: de sel bar byed cing med par byed pas na bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed do //🔽bdud kyi dpung rnams pham byed pa ni bdud thams cad kyi dpung ni bdud kyi dpung ste de'o //
analyzed: de sel bar byed cing med par byed pas na bdud bzhi'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed do // bdud kyi dpung rnams pham byed pa ni bdud thams cad kyi dpung ni bdud kyi dpung ste de'o //
translated: Since he removes and destroys them, he is the remover of the fear of the four demons.🔽The conqueror of the hosts of demons is the one who has the method of conquering all the hosts of demons, which are the hosts of demons.

original: de pham bar byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni bdud kyi dpung rnams pham byed pa'o //
analyzed: de pham bar byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni bdud kyi dpung rnams pham byed pa'o //
translated: The one who has that is the conqueror of the hosts of demons.

original: rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas ni mtshan rnams nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas ni mtshan rnams nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The perfect Buddha is the one who teaches the collection of names.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavan Buddha

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa dang po nas ji tsam 'di'i mthar thug pa'i bar du na 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa phal cher la gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa dang po nas ji tsam 'di'i mthar thug pa'i bar du na 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa phal cher la gsungs pa'o //
translated: is the perfect Buddha, from the beginning up to here, in most of the Mañjuśrī's Names.

original: 'jig rten 'dren ni 'jig rten rnams kyi 'dren pa po 'jig rten 'dren te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dren ni 'jig rten rnams kyi 'dren pa po 'jig rten 'dren te /
translated: The leader of the world is the one who leads the world, the leader of the world.

original: 'gro ba kun mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the one who is desired by all beings.

original: mchod 'os bstod 'os phyag gi gnas //
analyzed: mchod 'os bstod 'os phyag gi gnas //
translated: He is worthy of worship, praise, and homage,

original: rtag tu ri mor bya ba'i 'os //
analyzed: rtag tu ri mor bya ba'i 'os //
translated: always worthy of being honored,

original: bkur 'os rjed par bya ba'i 'os //
analyzed: bkur 'os rjed par bya ba'i 'os //
translated: worthy of respect, worthy of being revered,

original: phyag byar 'os pa bla ma'i rab //🔽ces @103a * //
analyzed: phyag byar 'os pa bla ma'i rab // ces @103a * //
translated: the best of gurus, worthy of offerings.

original: pa ni de la mchod 'os ni thos pa dang dran pa rnams yongs su mthar phyin ba ni mchod 'os zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: pa ni de la mchod 'os ni thos pa dang dran pa rnams yongs su mthar phyin ba ni mchod 'os zhes brjod pa /
translated: He is worthy of worship because he has perfected learning and mindfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yang grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa'i phyir na mchod 'os zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yang grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa'i phyir na mchod 'os zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One Mañjuśrī is said to be worthy of worship because he has reached the culmination of all philosophical systems.

original: bstod 'os ni bstod par 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bstod 'os ni bstod par 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is worthy of praise because he is worthy of praise.

original: phyag gi gnas ni lha rnams dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag gi gnas ni lha rnams dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyis phyag bya bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is worthy of homage because he is worthy of homage by the world with its gods.

original: rtog tu ri mor bya ba'i 'os ni nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyis ri mor bya bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog tu ri mor bya ba'i 'os ni nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyis ri mor bya bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is always worthy of being honored because he is worthy of being honored by all śrāvakas and others.

original: bkur 'os ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir na 'jam dpal nyid byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: bkur 'os ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir na 'jam dpal nyid byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis so //
translated: The venerable one is Mañjuśrī himself, because he is the perfection of all good qualities.

original: rjed par bya ba'i mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rjed par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rjed par bya ba'i mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rjed par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The most venerable one is the object of veneration of all the Tathāgatas.

original: phyag byar 'os pa ni sngags kyi sgo spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis phyag byar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag byar 'os pa ni sngags kyi sgo spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis phyag byar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The one worthy of worship is worthy of worship by those who practice the conduct of the mantra gateway.

original: bla ma ni sems can 'di dag thams cad la rjes su ston pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bla ma ni sems can 'di dag thams cad la rjes su ston pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The guru is the one who teaches all these beings, and who abides in the hearts of all the Tathāgatas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na rab ni mchog gi phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na rab ni mchog gi phyir te /
translated: For that very reason, he is the supreme one.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He himself is the Blessed One.

original: 'jig rten gsum nyid gom gcig bgrod //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum nyid gom gcig bgrod //
translated: The three worlds are traversed in one step.

original: mkha' ltar mtha' med rnam par gnon //
analyzed: mkha' ltar mtha' med rnam par gnon //
translated: He conquers like space, without end.

original: gsum rig gtsang ma dag pa ste ;
analyzed: gsum rig gtsang ma dag pa ste ;
translated: He is pure, the knower of the three.

original: / mngon shes drug ldan rjes dran drug / ces pa ni de la 'jig rten gsum nyid gom gcig bgrod ni 'jig rten gsum po rnams mnyam por bsdus pa ni 'jig rten gsum ste /
analyzed: / mngon shes drug ldan rjes dran drug / ces pa ni de la 'jig rten gsum nyid gom gcig bgrod ni 'jig rten gsum po rnams mnyam por bsdus pa ni 'jig rten gsum ste /
translated: 6. He who in a single step traverses the three worlds, and who has the six super-knowledges and the six remembrances.

original: 'jig rten gsum nyid ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum nyid ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: The three worlds are the three worlds combined.

original: 'jig rten gsum po de la gom pa gcig kho nas bgrod pa'i zhabs dang gang ldan pa de 'jig rten gsum nyid gom gcig bgrod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po de la gom pa gcig kho nas bgrod pa'i zhabs dang gang ldan pa de 'jig rten gsum nyid gom gcig bgrod do //
translated: He who in a single step traverses the three worlds, and who has the six super-knowledges and the six remembrances.

original: des ni bcom ldan 'das de'i rdzu 'phrul chen po'i bdag nyid yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni bcom ldan 'das de'i rdzu 'phrul chen po'i bdag nyid yang dag par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the Blessed One's greatness of miraculous power.🔽7. He who is like space, infinite, and victorious,

original: mkha' ltar mtha' med rnam par gnon ni mkha' ni mkha'o //
analyzed: mkha' ltar mtha' med rnam par gnon ni mkha' ni mkha'o //
translated: Space is space.

original: de yongs su mtha' yas pa ni mtha' ltar mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su mtha' yas pa ni mtha' ltar mtha' med pa'o //
translated: It is infinite because it is limitless.

original: de rnam par gnon pa ni pa rol gnon pa gang yin pa de ni mkha' ltar mtha' med rnam par gnon no //
analyzed: de rnam par gnon pa ni pa rol gnon pa gang yin pa de ni mkha' ltar mtha' med rnam par gnon no //
translated: He who is victorious over it is like space, infinite, and victorious.

original: tshig des kyang bcom ldan 'das de'i sems can gyi don du gnon pa nges par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig des kyang bcom ldan 'das de'i sems can gyi don du gnon pa nges par ston pa yin no //
translated: The word “knows” indicates that the Bhagavat is certain to subdue the sentient beings for whose sake he has appeared.

original: gsum rig ni rig byed rig par bstan pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gsum rig ni rig byed rig par bstan pa gsum ste /
translated: “Knows the three Vedas” indicates that he knows the three Vedas.

original: nges brjod dang / mchod sbyin dang / snyan ngag gi @103b mtshan nyid rnams ni rig byed gsum po gsum ldan dang / rjes su lta ba dang / gtam gyi mtshan nyid kyang rung ba bsgrub pa 'am rig pas na gsum rig go //
analyzed: nges brjod dang / mchod sbyin dang / snyan ngag gi @103b mtshan nyid rnams ni rig byed gsum po gsum ldan dang / rjes su lta ba dang / gtam gyi mtshan nyid kyang rung ba bsgrub pa 'am rig pas na gsum rig go //
translated: The three Vedas are the Rg Veda, the Yajur Veda, and the Sama Veda.

original: de'i rang bzhin yang bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yang bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavat is the nature of those three.

original: yang na theg pa gsum po nyid kyis bsdus pa ste sde snod gsum gyi rang bzhin rig pa ni gsum po sgrub pas sam rig pas na'o //
analyzed: yang na theg pa gsum po nyid kyis bsdus pa ste sde snod gsum gyi rang bzhin rig pa ni gsum po sgrub pas sam rig pas na'o //
translated: Or else, he is the knower of the three because he knows the nature of the three baskets, which are included in the three vehicles, by accomplishing or knowing them.

original: yang rdzu 'phrul dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin rig pas na gsum rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang rdzu 'phrul dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin rig pas na gsum rig pa'o //
translated: Or else, he is the knower of the three because he knows the nature of the superknowledges of magical power, knowledge of the minds of others, and knowledge of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na gtsang ma zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na gtsang ma zhes pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is called “pure.”

original: rig byed rig pa'i rang bzhin lta ba yin la /
analyzed: rig byed rig pa'i rang bzhin lta ba yin la /
translated: The nature of the Veda is the view.

original: 'dun pas 'dod phyir na gtsang ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dun pas 'dod phyir na gtsang ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is called pure because it is desired by the desire for the vehicle of the innumerable.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yang grangs med pa'i theg pa la 'dun pas 'dod pa'i phyir na gtsang ma zhes gsungs so //🔽dag pa ni des dag par byed pas na dag pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yang grangs med pa'i theg pa la 'dun pas 'dod pa'i phyir na gtsang ma zhes gsungs so // dag pa ni des dag par byed pas na dag pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat Mañjuśrī is called pure because he is desired by the desire for the vehicle of the innumerable.🔽Pure is that which purifies.

original: dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it is the cause of purity.

original: de ltar yang bshad pa chen po las gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang bshad pa chen po las gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said in the Mahāvibhāṣā:🔽“The earth element in water is completely pure,🔽and in water the mantras are supremely pure,

original: sa la chu'i sa yongs su dag / chu la 'ang sngags rnams mchog tu dag / de yang dus tshod tshogs pas dag / drang srong chen pos lung bstan gsungs //
analyzed: sa la chu'i sa yongs su dag / chu la 'ang sngags rnams mchog tu dag / de yang dus tshod tshogs pas dag / drang srong chen pos lung bstan gsungs //
translated: and that is pure by the assembly of the right times,🔽the great sage has declared.”

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das dag pa nyid kyi phyir na dag pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das dag pa nyid kyi phyir na dag pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus the Bhagavat is called pure because of purity itself.

original: mngon shes drug ldan ni lha'i rna ba dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: mngon shes drug ldan ni lha'i rna ba dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The six superknowledges are the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the thoughts of others, the recollection of former lives, the knowledge of magical power, and the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities.

original: mngon par shes pa de rnams drug dang gang ldan pa de mngon shes drug ldan no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de rnams drug dang gang ldan pa de mngon shes drug ldan no //
translated: He who possesses these six superknowledges is called the one who has the six superknowledges.

original: rjes dran drug ni ji snyed gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / rigs rjes su dran pa dang / khro bo rjes su dran pa dang / dam tshig rjes su dran pa rnams so //
analyzed: rjes dran drug ni ji snyed gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / rigs rjes su dran pa dang / khro bo rjes su dran pa dang / dam tshig rjes su dran pa rnams so //
translated: The six recollections are the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dharma, the recollection of the Sangha, the recollection of the lineage, the recollection of the wrathful, and the recollection of the commitments.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dran pa dang gang ldan pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dran pa dang gang ldan pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he who possesses the recollections is called that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: The Bodhisattva, the Great Being,

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po 'jig rten 'das //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po 'jig rten 'das //
translated: the one of great magical power, has transcended the world.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i mtha' //
translated: The limit of the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab de nyid de nyid thob //
analyzed: shes rab de nyid de nyid thob //
translated: is the attainment of that suchness itself.

original: ces pa ni de la byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la chags pa med pas byang chub ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni de la byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la chags pa med pas byang chub ste /
translated: Here, a bodhisattva is enlightened because he is unattached to all things.

original: rang gi don phun su ma tshogs pa la sems dpa'i blo dang dang ldan pa de byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don phun su ma tshogs pa la sems dpa'i blo dang dang ldan pa de byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: He is a bodhisattva because he has the mind of a bodhisattva with regard to the perfection of his own goal.

original: de ltar yin na nyan thos la thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i @104a * //
analyzed: de ltar yin na nyan thos la thal bar 'gyur ro // de'i @104a * //
translated: If that is so, he would be a śrāvaka.

original: phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems dpa' che zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' che zhes pa ste /
translated: A great being.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chen po la sems dpa'i blo dang gang ldan pa de sems dpa' che'o //🔽chen po yang gzhan du 'gyur ta /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chen po la sems dpa'i blo dang gang ldan pa de sems dpa' che'o // chen po yang gzhan du 'gyur ta /
translated: He is a great being because he has the mind of a being with regard to the perfection of the goal of others.

original: mu stegs kyi skye bo bzang po lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: mu stegs kyi skye bo bzang po lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: But a great being is also a tīrthika, like the good people.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: a bodhisattva.

original: de bas na tshig de gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshig de gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is indicated by these two terms.

original: de yang 'jig rten 'das zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten 'das zhes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, he is transcendent, as it is said:

original: 'khor ba'i chu bo chen po'i rgyud las kun du brgal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chu bo chen po'i rgyud las kun du brgal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has completely crossed over the stream of the great river of cyclic existence.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Great wonder-working power is due to the perfection of the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtha' ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtha' ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The limit of the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of the discernment of phenomena.

original: de'i mtha' ni mthar phyin cing mjug brtul bar son pa gang yin bde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mthar phyin cing mjug brtul bar son pa gang yin bde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The limit of that is the limit of the perfection of wisdom, which is the culmination and completion of that.

original: shes rab de nyid ni shes rab de kho na ste ;
analyzed: shes rab de nyid ni shes rab de kho na ste ;
translated: That very wisdom is that suchness.

original: shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: That wisdom is nondual pristine wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //🔽de nyid thob pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kho na ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid do // de nyid thob pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kho na ste /
translated: The Lord is that suchness.🔽The attainment of that is the attainment of that nondual pristine wisdom.

original: de thob cing mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de thob cing mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: That is what is meant by the attainment of that.

original: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
analyzed: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
translated: He is self-aware and aware of others, and is all-pervading.

original: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog /
analyzed: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog /
translated: He is the supreme person, the benefactor of all.

original: dper bya kun las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dper bya kun las 'das pa ste /
translated: He is beyond all analogies,🔽and is the supreme lord of the knower and the known.

original: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces pa ni de la bdag rig ni bdag nyid rig pas na bdag rig go //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces pa ni de la bdag rig ni bdag nyid rig pas na bdag rig go //
translated: He is self-aware because he is aware of himself.

original: gzhan rig ni gzhan rnams rig pas na gzhan rig go //
analyzed: gzhan rig ni gzhan rnams rig pas na gzhan rig go //
translated: He is aware of others because he is aware of others.

original: thams cad ni ma lus pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma lus pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is all-pervading because he pervades all things without exception.

original: kun la phan pa ni thams cad la phan pa byed pas na kun la phan pa ste /🔽'gro ba kun la bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyu de'i phyir na gang zag mchog ste /
analyzed: kun la phan pa ni thams cad la phan pa byed pas na kun la phan pa ste / 'gro ba kun la bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa'i phyir ro // rgyu de'i phyir na gang zag mchog ste /
translated: He is the benefactor of all because he acts as the benefactor of all.🔽He is the supreme person because he is the supreme person.

original: bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the supreme person because he is the supreme person.

original: dper bya kun las 'das pa ste ni dngos po 'di thams cad kyi dper bya kun no //
analyzed: dper bya kun las 'das pa ste ni dngos po 'di thams cad kyi dper bya kun no //
translated: He is beyond all analogies because he is beyond all analogies.

original: dper bya de kun las 'das pa shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de ni dper bya kun las 'das so zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dper bya de kun las 'das pa shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de ni dper bya kun las 'das so zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That which is beyond all of these examples, which is utterly beyond, is beyond all examples.

original: shes pa'i bdag po ni 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag po ni 'dzin pa po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The dominant condition is the nature of the grasper.

original: mchog ni rab nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ni rab nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Supreme means the best.

original: chos kyi sbyin bdag gtso bo ste //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin bdag gtso bo ste //
translated: The foremost donor of the gift of Dharma,

original: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa /
translated: teaching the meaning of the four seals,

original: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog /
translated: the supreme object of worship for beings,

original: @104b nges 'byung gsum po bgrod pa po //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: @104b nges 'byung gsum po bgrod pa po // zhes pa ni /
translated: the traveler of the three definite exits.

original: de la chos kyi sbyin bdag ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par chos kyi sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sbyin bdag ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par chos kyi sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among those, the donor of the gift of Dharma is the foremost because of giving the gift of Dharma without error according to fortune.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na gtso bo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na gtso bo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is called the foremost.

original: mngon par 'gro bar bya ba rnams kyi nang na mchog ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'gro bar bya ba rnams kyi nang na mchog ste /
translated: Among those to be approached, it is the best.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
translated: That very Bhagavān.

original: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bzhi rnams kyi don ni phyag rgya bzhi'i don te /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi po'i don ston pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bzhi rnams kyi don ni phyag rgya bzhi'i don te /
translated: The one who teaches the meaning of the four seals is the one who teaches the meaning of the four seals, the great seal, etc.

original: de'i ston pa po ni rab tu ston pa po'o //
analyzed: de'i ston pa po ni rab tu ston pa po'o //
translated: He is the one who teaches them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because he is the nature of the gnosis body of all the Tathagatas,

original: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bsnyen bkur gnas kyi mchog /
translated: he is the supreme object of worship of the world.

original: ces bya'o // nges 'byung gsum po ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya'o // nges 'byung gsum po ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The three liberations are the liberations of the Sravakas, etc.

original: des bgrod pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni nges 'byung gsum gyis bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: des bgrod pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de ni nges 'byung gsum gyis bgrod pa'o //
translated: He who possesses the way of proceeding by means of those is the one who proceeds by means of the three liberations.

original: de bas na nges 'byung gsum gyis bgrod ba'i 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsnyen bkur gyi gnas ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na nges 'byung gsum gyis bgrod ba'i 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsnyen bkur gyi gnas ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One himself is the object of worship of all the beings who proceed by means of the three liberations,

original: thar ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thar ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the nature of all liberation.

original: don gyi dam pa rnam dag dpal //
analyzed: don gyi dam pa rnam dag dpal //
translated: He is the glory of the pure highest meaning,

original: 'jig rten gsum na skal bzang che //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na skal bzang che //
translated: the great good fortune of the three worlds.

original: dpal ldan 'byor pa kun byed pa //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'byor pa kun byed pa //
translated: The glorious one who creates all prosperity,🔽Mañjuśrī, the most glorious of the glorious.

original: 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog / ces pa ni de la don dam chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam par dag pa'i dpal dang gang ldan pa de ni don gyi dam pa rnam dag dpal te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog / ces pa ni de la don dam chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam par dag pa'i dpal dang gang ldan pa de ni don gyi dam pa rnam dag dpal te /
translated: Here, the one who possesses the glory of the purity of the ultimate realm of phenomena is the ultimate glory of purity.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the embodiment of method and wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na 'jig rten gsum na skal bzang ni 'jig rten gsum kho na la skal ba bzang po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na 'jig rten gsum na skal bzang ni 'jig rten gsum kho na la skal ba bzang po ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is the good fortune of the three worlds, the good fortune of the three worlds themselves.

original: sems can kun gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar yang dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Śrī-Parama-Śāstra:

original: sems can kun don byed phyir na //
analyzed: sems can kun don byed phyir na //
translated: Because he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings,

original: skal bzang bcom ldan rdo rje can ;
analyzed: skal bzang bcom ldan rdo rje can ;
translated: the glorious Bhagavān is the vajra holder.

original: / gtan du mya ngan 'das phyir na //
analyzed: / gtan du mya ngan 'das phyir na //
translated: Because he is eternally in nirvāṇa,

original: nyan thos thams cad skal ngan yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos thams cad skal ngan yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: all śrāvakas are unfortunate.

original: che ni kun la khyab ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: che ni kun la khyab ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Great means that he pervades all.

original: dpal ldan ni skal ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal ldan ni skal ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Glorious means endowed with perfect fortune.

original: 'byor pa kun byed pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten gyi dngos po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byor pa kun byed pa ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten gyi dngos po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Universal prosperity means the basis of all perfection.

original: 'jam dpal ni mtshan brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ni mtshan brjod pa yin no //
translated: Mañju means to proclaim the name.

original: dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ni de dang ldan pa'i nang na rab ces pa'i don to //🔽de ltar de nas de ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs @105a * //
analyzed: dpal dang ldan pa'i mchog ni de dang ldan pa'i nang na rab ces pa'i don to // de ltar de nas de ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs @105a * //
translated: The supreme glory means the best among those who possess it.

original: pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya kun yang dag par rig pa'i bya ba sna tshogs mdzad pa'i phyir ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad la bsam pa kun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de nyid phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i
analyzed: pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya kun yang dag par rig pa'i bya ba sna tshogs mdzad pa'i phyir ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad la bsam pa kun yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de nyid phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i
translated: Thus, then, that very Blessed One, the wisdom being of all tathāgatas, by the nature of the wisdom of purposeful activity, in order to perform the various activities of the knowledge of all the seals of all tathāgatas, for the complete fulfillment of all wishes of the entire realm of sentient beings without exception, that very one, in the infinite, limitless ten directions,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su khyab par son pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su khyab par son pas /
translated: Since it pervades all world systems,

original: mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge tshig dgu bcu rtsa lnga rnams rigs kyi dbye bas rnam pa lngar bgos te /
analyzed: mtshan gyi sngags kyi yi ge tshig dgu bcu rtsa lnga rnams rigs kyi dbye bas rnam pa lngar bgos te /
translated: the mantra syllables of the name are divided into five types by the divisions of the families.

original: rnam pa re re zhing yang mtshan gyi yi ger gyur pa rnam pa bcu dgu bcu dgur byas te /
analyzed: rnam pa re re zhing yang mtshan gyi yi ger gyur pa rnam pa bcu dgu bcu dgur byas te /
translated: Each of those is divided into nineteen types, which become the syllables of the name.

original: de rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi le lo med par byas nas dge ba'i phyogs la gnas par byas te /🔽rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas de'i 'od kyis yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad gsal bar byas nas yang de rnams slar log nas gong du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig rnams su gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi le lo med par byas nas dge ba'i phyogs la gnas par byas te / rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas de'i 'od kyis yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad gsal bar byas nas yang de rnams slar log nas gong du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi sngags kyi yi ge'i tshig rnams su gyur te /
translated: Those eliminate the laziness of all sentient beings and cause them to abide in virtue.🔽From the door of their own liberation, their light illuminates all the maṇḍalas of the retinue of tathāgatas.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyi rol 'khor lo lnga pa la ji lta ba'i rim pas rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyi rol 'khor lo lnga pa la ji lta ba'i rim pas rnam par gnas so //
translated: Again, they return and become the mantra syllables of the words of the characteristics mentioned above, abiding in the five circles outside the great maṇḍala of Vajradhātu in the sequence as before.

original: yang ji ltar gsungs pa'i gzugs su bdag nyid dmigs te /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gsungs pa'i gzugs su bdag nyid dmigs te /
translated: Also, having visualized oneself in the form as taught,

original: sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa klog pas 'og nas 'byung ba'i yon tan thob po zhes pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa klog pas 'og nas 'byung ba'i yon tan thob po zhes pa ni man ngag go //
translated: the son or daughter of good lineage who practices the mantra path, by reading Noble Mañjuśrī's Praise in Hundred and Fifty Names, will attain the qualities that will be explained below. This is the instruction.

original: 'di la tshigs bcad ni bco lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di la tshigs bcad ni bco lnga'o //
translated: Here there are fifteen verses.

original: mtshan gyi sngags kyi tshig rnams ni dgu bcu rtsa lnga ste grangs so //
analyzed: mtshan gyi sngags kyi tshig rnams ni dgu bcu rtsa lnga ste grangs so //
translated: The mantra words of the names are ninety-five, which is the enumeration.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste bcu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa ste bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the tenth chapter of the extensive treatise on the praise in one hundred and fifty names, which is the view of the meaning of the mantra names, from the perspective of the wisdom of practice.

original: // / da ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi tshigs bcad rnams kyi bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i dbus na bzhugs pa la bstod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: // / da ni rnam par snang mdzad chen po la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi tshigs bcad rnams kyi bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i dbus na bzhugs pa la bstod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Now, in praise of the Bhagavat’s gnosis body dwelling in the center of the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm, there are verses on the nature of the five tathāgatas, Mahāvairocana and so on.

original: mchog sbyin la sogs pas ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: mchog sbyin la sogs pas ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: By “bestowing the supreme” and so on, it is by way of mirror-like gnosis.

original: sangs rgyas chags pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chags pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
translated: By “buddha passion” and so on, it is by way of the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas 'dzum pa la sogs pas ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dzum pa la sogs pas ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: By “buddha smile” and so on, it is by way of individually discerning gnosis.

original: med pa las byung @105b la sogs pas ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: med pa las byung @105b la sogs pas ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: By “arisen from nonexistence” and so on, it is by way of the gnosis of equanimity.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pas ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la sogs pas ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: By “illusion net” and so on, it is by way of the gnosis of successful activities.

original: tshigs bcad lnga'o //
analyzed: tshigs bcad lnga'o //
translated: There are five verses.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstod pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa bcu gcig ba ste yongs su rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstod pa'i rim pa'i dbang du byas pa bcu gcig ba ste yongs su rdzogs so /
translated: The eleventh chapter is concluded, which is a summary from the perspective of the praise in the extensive commentary on the Noble Praise in Honor of One Worthy of Honor, the Meaning of the Secret Mantra.

original: // / de nas da ni yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa la /
analyzed: // / de nas da ni yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa la /
translated: Now, the praise from the perspective of qualities.

original: de la re zhig rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo nas yon tan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo nas yon tan gsungs pa /
translated: Among them, first, the qualities are stated from the perspective of the first maṇḍala of the vajra realm.

original: phag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Vajra holder, Vajradhara, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rdo rje 'dzin pa pos pa ni de kho na gsol pa btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rdo rje 'dzin pa pos pa ni de kho na gsol pa btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavān Śākyamuni is addressed by Vajrapāṇi because he requested the suchness.

original: de kho na la bos pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de kho na la bos pa mdzad de /
translated: He is addressed by that suchness.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yon tan dang bcas pa gsungs pa ni dang pa ldan pa rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yon tan dang bcas pa gsungs pa ni dang pa ldan pa rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: The statement of the praise in honor of one worthy of honor together with its qualities is stated in order to engage those with faith.

original: phag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang 'di dang 'di dang 'di ni zhes pa ni 'di dang 'di ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //🔽kye phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: phag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang 'di dang 'di dang 'di ni zhes pa ni 'di dang 'di ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o // kye phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni dbang bskur ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: The phrase O Vajrapāṇi refers to the name of Mañjuśrī in terms of his consecration.🔽The phrase Vajrapāṇi refers to the name of Mañjuśrī in terms of his gnosis.

original: rdo rje 'chang ni ye shes kyi sgo nas so //🔽yon tan de gnyis dang ldan pas sdud par byed pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ni ye shes kyi sgo nas so // yon tan de gnyis dang ldan pas sdud par byed pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase O Vajrapāṇi refers to the name of Mañjuśrī in terms of his being the compiler of the tantra.

original: bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi sku /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi sku /
translated: The Bhagavān is the embodiment of gnosis.🔽The Tathāgata is the embodiment of Mañjuśrī, the embodiment of gnosis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' dang 'brel pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yin te /
translated: The phrase the recitation of the names refers to the recitation of the names of Mañjuśrī, the embodiment of the gnosis of all the tathāgatas.

original: mi 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: If you ask, What is the difference between the Bhagavān and the Tathāgata?

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yongs su dag pa zhes pa ni //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yongs su dag pa zhes pa ni //
translated: The phrase the uncommon purity refers to the fact that the Bhagavān is the embodiment of gnosis.

original: de la thun mong ni nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de la thun mong ni nyon mongs pa dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: The phrase the common purity refers to the fact that the Tathāgata is the embodiment of form.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig ma 'dres pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig ma 'dres pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase the uncommon purity refers to the fact that the Bhagavān is the embodiment of gnosis.

original: dag pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: dag pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: The phrase the common purity refers to the fact that the Tathāgata is the embodiment of form.🔽The phrase the uncommon purity refers to the fact that the Bhagavān is the embodiment of gnosis.

original: srid pa dang ma 'dres pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de dag gis zhes bstan to zhes phyis 'byung ba'i tshig dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang ma 'dres pa yongs su dag pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de dag gis zhes bstan to zhes phyis 'byung ba'i tshig dang 'brel pa /
translated: The phrase by those who are unadulterated with existence, who are completely pure, and who recite the true words of the characteristics is connected with the later phrase.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: gsungs pa / khyod kyis dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mgu ba chen po bla na med pa bskyed pa'i don dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa / khyod kyis dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mgu ba chen po bla na med pa bskyed pa'i don dang zhes pa ni /
translated: It says, for the purpose of generating in you the unsurpassed great joy, faith, and delight.

original: de la dga' ba ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni spro ba'o //
translated: Among those, joy is enthusiasm.

original: dad pa ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni dad pa ste /
translated: Faith is confidence.

original: de yang las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: de yang las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la yid ches pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is confidence in actions, results, the truths, and the jewels.

original: mgu ba chen po ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mgu ba chen po ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Great delight is effort.

original: de yang dge ba'i chos la mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i chos la mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is enthusiasm for virtuous dharmas.

original: phyag na rdo rje khyod kyis de rnams bskyed @106a * //🔽pa ni 'byung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje khyod kyis de rnams bskyed @106a * // pa ni 'byung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: You, Vajrapāṇi, generate those for the purpose of arising.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis gsang ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i don dang zhes pa la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis gsang ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i don dang zhes pa la /
translated: The phrase for the purpose of purifying the secret of body, speech, and mind is as follows.

original: lus ngag yid rnams kyi gsang ba ni byang chub sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: lus ngag yid rnams kyi gsang ba ni byang chub sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The secret of body, speech, and mind is the nature of the vajra of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: de yongs su dag par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de yongs su dag par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of purifying that.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dang / yongs su ma dag pa'i sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su dag par bya ba dang zhes pa /🔽yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i sa rnams dang yongs su dag pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dang / yongs su ma dag pa'i sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su dag par bya ba dang zhes pa / yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i sa rnams dang yongs su dag pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
translated: The accumulations of merit and wisdom of the stages and perfections that are incomplete and impure are to be completed and purified.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa rnams dang / yongs su ma dag pa'i sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa rnams dang / yongs su ma dag pa'i sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: The stages that are incomplete and the perfections that are impure🔽are the accumulations of merit and wisdom of those that are incomplete and impure.

original: de rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su dag par byed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su dag par byed pa'i don du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of completing and purifying those.

original: bla na med pa'i don ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i don yang de yin la ma rtogs pa yang de nyid yin pas bla na med pa'i don ma rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i don ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang zhes pa ni bla na med pa'i don yang de yin la ma rtogs pa yang de nyid yin pas bla na med pa'i don ma rtogs pa ste /
translated: In order to realize the unsurpassed meaning that has not been realized means that the unsurpassed meaning is just that, and it is not realized, so it is the unsurpassed meaning that has not been realized.

original: de rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is for the purpose of realizing that.

original: ma thob pa thob pa thob par bya ba dang zhes pa ni ma thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa thob pa thob par bya ba dang zhes pa ni ma thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to attain what has not been attained means for the purpose of attaining the Buddha qualities and so on that have not been attained.

original: ji srid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni ji srid kyi sgra'i rim pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni ji srid kyi sgra'i rim pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: For as long as it is in order to uphold the way of Dharma of all the Tathagatas means that it depends on the sequence of the word as long as.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam pa'i chos kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam pa'i chos kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The way of the sublime Dharma of all the Tathagatas is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis yang dag par gzung bar bya ba'i don du ngas bshad cing zhes pa ni byang chub sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis yang dag par gzung bar bya ba'i don du ngas bshad cing zhes pa ni byang chub sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
translated: I have explained the meaning of the two in union, which is to be held by the nature of gnosis. This is from the perspective of the nature of bodhicitta-vajra.

original: kha stan te zhes pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: kha stan te zhes pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: I have revealed it is from the perspective of the gnosis of the utterly pure dharmadhātu.

original: bkrol zhing zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: bkrol zhing zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: I have disclosed it is from the perspective of mirrorlike gnosis.

original: rnam par phye la zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rnam par phye la zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: I have analyzed it is from the perspective of the gnosis of equality.

original: byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: I have blessed it is from the perspective of the gnosis of successful activities.

original: kyi lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni bod pa'i don to //
analyzed: kyi lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni bod pa'i don to //
translated: To Vajrapāṇi is the object of the teaching.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words of the mantra.

original: ngas zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa ngas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ngas zhes pa ni sh'akya thub pa ngas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: I have is the meaning of “I, Śākyamuni.”

original: khyod kyi rgyud la zhes pa ni khyod kyi sems kyi rgyud la'o zhes pa'i don to //🔽gsang sngags thams cad kyi chos nyid kyis byin gyi rlabs @106b kyis brlab po zhes pa ni gsang sngags thams cad kyi chos nyid ni gsang sngags thams cad kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: khyod kyi rgyud la zhes pa ni khyod kyi sems kyi rgyud la'o zhes pa'i don to // gsang sngags thams cad kyi chos nyid kyis byin gyi rlabs @106b kyis brlab po zhes pa ni gsang sngags thams cad kyi chos nyid ni gsang sngags thams cad kyi chos nyid de /
translated: In your continuum means in your mental continuum.

original: stong ba nyid do //
analyzed: stong ba nyid do //
translated: It is consecrated by the consecration of the reality of all mantras means the reality of all mantras is the emptiness of all mantras.

original: de byin gyis brlabs pa ni brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de byin gyis brlabs pa ni brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: It is consecrated means it is stabilized.

original: 'khor lo dang po yin tan te /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang po yin tan te /
translated: This is the first chapter.

original: tshigs bcad bcu gcig ste grangs so //
analyzed: tshigs bcad bcu gcig ste grangs so //
translated: It has eleven verses.

original: da ni 'khor lo gnyis pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'khor lo gnyis pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: Now, from the perspective of the benefits of the second wheel, it is said:

original: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang gzhan yang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shin tu dag cing yongs su byang ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang bar gyur ba'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang gzhan yang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shin tu dag cing yongs su byang ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs gsang bar gyur ba'o zhes pa la /
translated: Subjugating the Three Worlds Vajrapāṇi, moreover, this expression of the name is the secret of the omniscience of all tathāgatas, which is very pure and completely purified, and the secret of their body, speech, and mind.

original: kun nas yongs su bya ba ni shin tu yongs su dag cing yongs su byang ba yang de yin la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang de nyid yin pas shin tu dag cing yongs su byang ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: kun nas yongs su bya ba ni shin tu yongs su dag cing yongs su byang ba yang de yin la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyang de nyid yin pas shin tu dag cing yongs su byang ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the thoroughly pure and purified omniscient wisdom because it is the thoroughly pure and purified omniscient wisdom.

original: de'i sku gsung thugs kyi cha de rnams gsang bar gyur pa ni snang ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sku gsung thugs kyi cha de rnams gsang bar gyur pa ni snang ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Those aspects of his body, speech, and mind are secret because they are not of the nature of appearance.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub po zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub po zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni /
translated: The enlightenment of the buddhas is the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ste /
translated: It is the enlightenment of the buddhas,

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: not the enlightenment of the śrāvakas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa ni ye shes te //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes pa ni mngon par rtogs pa ni ye shes te //
translated: It is the realization of the perfect buddhas. Realization is wisdom.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bla na med pa'o zhes pa ni de'i gong na med pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bla na med pa'o zhes pa ni de'i gong na med pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas are unsurpassed, because there is nothing higher than them.

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud pa'o zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud pa'o zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma realm of the Sugatas is realized, because it has the nature of emptiness.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis bdud kyi stobs thams cad pham par mdzad pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis bdud kyi stobs thams cad pham par mdzad pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The victors have defeated all the powers of Mara,

original: bdud bzhi'i stobs kyis mi thub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i stobs kyis mi thub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cannot be overcome by the powers of the four Maras.

original: stobs bcu dang ldan pa thams cad kyi stobs bcu nyid do zhes pa ni stobs bcu ni gong du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pa thams cad kyi stobs bcu nyid do zhes pa ni stobs bcu ni gong du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The ten powers of all those who possess the ten powers are the ten powers themselves, because the ten powers have the characteristics mentioned above.

original: de rnams dang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa dang ldan pa de stobs bcu'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa dang ldan pa de stobs bcu'o //
translated: Those who possess the Names and the Discourse on the Names are the ten powers.

original: de'i dngos po ni stobs bcu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni stobs bcu nyid do //
translated: The state of that is the ten powers themselves.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes pa ni thams cad shes pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes pa ni thams cad shes pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: All the knowledges of the Omniscient One are omniscience, because they know everything.

original: de'i ngo bo ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: Its essence is omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi lung ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan las 'ongs pa'i phyir lung ngo /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi lung ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan las 'ongs pa'i phyir lung ngo /
translated: The scriptural tradition of all the Buddha qualities means that it is a scriptural tradition because it comes from another.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: lung gi mtshan nyid dang / @107a * //
analyzed: lung gi mtshan nyid dang / @107a * //
translated: the scriptural tradition itself and

original: rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the tradition of realization.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par grub pa'o zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par grub pa'o zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis te /
translated: It is the perfect establishment of all the Buddhas means that it is the Buddhas of the sravaka vehicle and so on,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang gi ngo bos ma den du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang gi ngo bos ma den du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddhas of the sravaka vehicle and so on are not established by way of their own nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: It is the stainless and utterly pure perfection of the accumulations of merit and wisdom of all the great bodhisattvas means that

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang de yin la dri ma med pa yang de nyid yin pas na dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang de yin la dri ma med pa yang de nyid yin pas na dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: it is utterly pure and it is stainless, and so it is stainless and utterly pure.

original: de nyid bsod nams dang ye she kyi tshogs de yin la dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa yang de nyid yin la na dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i dri ma
analyzed: de nyid bsod nams dang ye she kyi tshogs de yin la dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa yang de nyid yin la na dri ma med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i dri ma
translated: That itself is the accumulation of merit and wisdom, and that itself is stainless and completely pure.

original: med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the stainless and completely pure perfection of the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa ste /
translated: That perfection is the Praise in Verse of the Exalted One.

original: de dang gang ldan pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang gang ldan pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: One who possesses that is called by that name.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi skye gnas ni de rnams kyi 'byung ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi skye gnas ni de rnams kyi 'byung ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The abode of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is the source of their origin.

original: lha dang mi thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi zhing ngo zhes pa ni //
analyzed: lha dang mi thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi zhing ngo zhes pa ni //
translated: The field of all the perfections of all gods and humans is

original: de la zhing ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zhing ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas kyi phyir ro //
translated: the field of all perfections because it is the source of all perfections.

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhi'o zhes pa ni sngar mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i theg pa chen po'i gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhi'o zhes pa ni sngar mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i theg pa chen po'i gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The basis of the Great Vehicle is the reality of the Great Vehicle, as previously stated in the definition.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams kyi 'byung khungs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams kyi 'byung khungs so zhes pa ni /
translated: The source of the bodhisattva practices is the source of the bodhisattva practices.

original: de la 'byung khungs ni skye ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'byung khungs ni skye ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The source is the place of origin.

original: 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyi mtha'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyi mtha'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The end of all the noble paths is the end of all the noble paths.

original: de la mtha' ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtha' ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The end is the conclusion.🔽The investigation of the liberated ones is the investigation of the liberated ones.

original: rnam par grol ba rnams kyi brtag pa'i zhes pa ni de la brtag pa ni yongs su brtag pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnams kyi brtag pa'i zhes pa ni de la brtag pa ni yongs su brtag pa'i gnas te /
translated: The investigation is the place of thorough investigation,

original: ji ltar gser la sreg pa dang bcad pa dang bdar ba'i gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gser la sreg pa dang bcad pa dang bdar ba'i gnas lta bu'o //
translated: like the place of burning, cutting, and rubbing gold.

original: des par 'byung ba'i lam skye ba'i gnas so zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs kyi rgyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des par 'byung ba'i lam skye ba'i gnas so zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs kyi rgyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The place of origin of the path of definite emergence is the place of origin of the path of definite emergence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdung mi 'chad pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdung mi 'chad pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The lineage of all the Tathagatas is the lineage of all the Tathagatas.

original: de la gdung mi 'chad pa ni rgyun rnam par mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: de la gdung mi 'chad pa ni rgyun rnam par mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: The non-interruption of the lineage is the non-interruption of the stream.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it performs the deeds of a Tathagata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rigs dang rgyud rab tu 'phel ba'o zhes pa ni de kho nar phul du byung @107b bas mchog tu dga' ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rigs dang rgyud rab tu 'phel ba'o zhes pa ni de kho nar phul du byung @107b bas mchog tu dga' ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The lineage and stream of the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva is greatly increased, which is the increase of supreme joy in reality.

original: pha rol rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa'o zhes pa ni gang gis tshar gcod par byed pa ni gcod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa'o zhes pa ni gang gis tshar gcod par byed pa ni gcod pa'o //
translated: All opponents are defeated, which is the defeat of those who are defeated.

original: de ltar yang dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa /🔽kha cig pha rol mu stegs rnams //
analyzed: de ltar yang dpal bde mchog gi rgyud las gsungs pa / kha cig pha rol mu stegs rnams //
translated: Thus it is said in the Shri-Paramadya Tantra:🔽Some, by means of the Dharma,

original: chos dang mthun par tshar gcod do //
analyzed: chos dang mthun par tshar gcod do //
translated: defeat the opponents, the tirthikas.

original: zhes so // mu stegs thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'o zhes pa ni //
analyzed: zhes so // mu stegs thams cad rnam par 'joms pa'o zhes pa ni //
translated: All tirthikas are destroyed,

original: de la 'joms pa ni chang gi che ba'i bdag nyid rab tu bstan pa'i sgo nas sba 'gong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'joms pa ni chang gi che ba'i bdag nyid rab tu bstan pa'i sgo nas sba 'gong bar byed pa ste /
translated: In that case, the destruction is the concealment by the teaching of the greatness of the liquor,

original: dper na lha las babs pa'i tshe lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha las babs pa'i tshe lta bu'o //
translated: as for example, when one descends from the gods.

original: bdud bzhi'i stobs kyi dpung dang sde pham par byed pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdud bzhi'i stobs kyi dpung dang sde pham par byed pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: It is the one that defeats the forces, armies, and troops of the four māras.

original: de la stobs ni yan lag bzhi'i stobs so //
analyzed: de la stobs ni yan lag bzhi'i stobs so //
translated: Here, strength is the strength of the four limbs.

original: dpung ni rnam par bkod pa'o //
analyzed: dpung ni rnam par bkod pa'o //
translated: An army is a formation.

original: de ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: That is a collection.

original: de'i phyir na don 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir na don 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: bdud bzhi rnams kyi stobs dang dpung dang sde pham par byed pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi rnams kyi stobs dang dpung dang sde pham par byed pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de'o //
translated: It is the one that defeats the forces, armies, and troops of the four māras, the dhāraṇī mantra that is called the Tadyathā.

original: sems can thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'o zhes pa ni de la sbyin pa dang ; snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'o zhes pa ni de la sbyin pa dang ; snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the one that gathers all sentient beings. Here, it has the characteristics of generosity, pleasant speech, meaningful conduct, and consistency of behavior.

original: de nyid des bsdus pa ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid des bsdus pa ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: That itself is gathered by that.

original: nges par 'byung ba bgrod pa thams cad kyi 'phags pa'i lam yongs su smin pa'o zhes pa dang / de la 'phags pa'i lam yongs su smin pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su smin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba bgrod pa thams cad kyi 'phags pa'i lam yongs su smin pa'o zhes pa dang / de la 'phags pa'i lam yongs su smin pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su smin pa nyid do //
translated: It is the ripening of the noble path of all who are traveling to liberation. Here, the ripening of the noble path is the ripening of the noble eightfold path.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi lag nas pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi lag nas pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni /
translated: The concentration of those who have attained the four divine abodes.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin ni nye bar brtags pa'i gzhi la sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin ni nye bar brtags pa'i gzhi la sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Here, concentration is one-pointedness of mind on a well-defined object.

original: de yang byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de yang byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is of four kinds: loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: sems rtse gcig pa rnams kyi bsam gtan no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa rnams kyi bsam gtan no zhes pa ni /
translated: The meditative absorption of those who have one-pointed minds.

original: de la bsam gtan ni rtog dpyod dang dga' bde zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan ni rtog dpyod dang dga' bde zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, meditative absorption is called investigation, analysis, joy, and bliss.

original: lus dang / ngag dang yid 'dul ba la brtson pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang yid 'dul ba la brtson pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor ro zhes pa ni /
translated: The yoga of those who are diligent in disciplining body, speech, and mind.

original: de la rnal 'byor ni sems tsam la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor ni sems tsam la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Here, yoga is meditative absorption in mind only.

original: kun du sbyor ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The freedom from all fetters.

original: de la kun du spyor ba dgu dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de la kun du spyor ba dgu dang bral ba ste /
translated: Here, it is freedom from the nine fetters.

original: kun du sbyor ba dgu ni rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang /🔽mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor @108a * //🔽ba dang / phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba dgu ni rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor @108a * // ba dang / phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: doubt, jealousy, avarice, and conceit.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs cad spong pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs cad spong pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / khong khro ba la sogs pa rnams spong ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of all defilements and secondary defilements refers to the abandonment of attachment and so on, and of anger and so on.

original: sgrib pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'o zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa rnams gtan du med pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'o zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa rnams gtan du med pa'o //
translated: The pacification of all obscurations refers to the permanent absence of the obscurations of the knowable, the afflictions, karma, and ripening.

original: 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi 'ching ba rnams las rnam par grol ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba thams cad las rnam par grol ba'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi 'ching ba rnams las rnam par grol ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is completely liberated from all bonds, because it is the cause of liberation from the bonds of passion, hatred, and folly.

original: phung po thams cad las thar pa'o zhes pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: phung po thams cad las thar pa'o zhes pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is liberation from all the aggregates, because it is characterized by the remainderless liberation.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of those.

original: sems kyi g-yeng ba thams cad zhi ba'o zhes pa ni zhi bar byed pas zhi bas zhi ba ste zhi bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi g-yeng ba thams cad zhi ba'o zhes pa ni zhi bar byed pas zhi bas zhi ba ste zhi bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the pacification of all mental disturbances, because it is pacified by pacification, due to its state of peace.

original: 'byor ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas so zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi 'byor pa'i 'byung gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byor ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas so zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi 'byor pa'i 'byung gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the source of all prosperity, because it is the source of all mundane and transcendental prosperity.

original: rgud pa thams cad sel ba'o zhes pa ni skyon thams cad spong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgud pa thams cad sel ba'o zhes pa ni skyon thams cad spong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
