original: mtshan gyi don gang yang rung ba re re nas kyang zhes pa ni //
analyzed: mtshan gyi don gang yang rung ba re re nas kyang zhes pa ni //
translated: Each of the meanings of the names.

original: mtshan rnams kyi don ni mtshan gyi don to //
analyzed: mtshan rnams kyi don ni mtshan gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the names means the meaning of the names.

original: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku la dmigs te sems rtse gcig tu bsgom pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku la dmigs te sems rtse gcig tu bsgom pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Focusing on the body of Mañjuśrī, the wisdom being, and meditating with a one-pointed mind.

original: de la sems rtse gcig ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid do //
analyzed: de la sems rtse gcig ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid do //
translated: One-pointed mind means the mind in meditative equipoise.

original: kun nas sgo'i gnas pas gnas pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas sgo'i gnas pas gnas pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Abiding in the abode of the universal gateway, and so forth.

original: de la mos pa ni de bzhin du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa ni de bzhin du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Interest means apprehending it in that way.

original: de kho na nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Reality means non-erroneously.

original: de bas na mos pa dang de kho na nyid gnyis yid la byed pas kun nas sgo'i gnas pas gnas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mos pa dang de kho na nyid gnyis yid la byed pas kun nas sgo'i gnas pas gnas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called abiding in the abode of the universal gateway by keeping in mind both interest and reality.

original: chos thams cad rtogs pa ni zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rtogs pa ni zhes pa ni /
translated: Realizing all phenomena.

original: de la chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena means the aggregates and so forth.

original: de rnams rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dad pas so //
analyzed: de rnams rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dad pas so //
translated: By faith that has the nature of realizing those.

original: des ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: des ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What kind of faith?

original: mchog ni rab bo //
analyzed: mchog ni rab bo //
translated: Supreme means excellent.

original: rnyog pa med pa ni skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ni skyon med pa'o //
translated: Without turbidity means without faults.

original: shes rab rjes su 'bigs pa'i dad pa dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab rjes su 'bigs pa'i dad pa dang zhes pa ni /
translated: Faith that pierces through with wisdom.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: dad pa nyid kyis chos ston to //
analyzed: dad pa nyid kyis chos ston to //
translated: Faith itself teaches the Dharma.

original: shes rab kyis ni de nyid rig / de gnyis la yang shes rab gtso //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni de nyid rig / de gnyis la yang shes rab gtso //
translated: Wisdom knows reality, and of the two, wisdom is the chief.

original: de'i yang sngon du dad pa 'gro //
analyzed: de'i yang sngon du dad pa 'gro //
translated: But faith precedes it.

original: zhes so // ldan bzhin ni gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: zhes so // ldan bzhin ni gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa can gyi'o //
translated: The one who is endowed is the one who practices the way of mantra.

original: de la dus gsum gyi dus med pa ni dus gsum ni dus rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la dus gsum gyi dus med pa ni dus gsum ni dus rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: As for the absence of the three times, the three times are the three kinds of time.

original: de la dus med pa'o //
analyzed: de la dus med pa'o //
translated: There is no time in that.

original: ldan pa ni yongs su 'brel par byed pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni yongs su 'brel par byed pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed means connected.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad 'dus te gshegs nas ni zhes pa ni 'dus nas 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad 'dus te gshegs nas ni zhes pa ni 'dus nas 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Having gathered and come means having gathered and gone.

original: chos kyi sgo thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: All the doors of Dharma are the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: rtogs par mdzad de sku yang ston to zhes so //
analyzed: rtogs par mdzad de sku yang ston to zhes so //
translated: They realize it and also show their bodies.

original: ma rungs pa 'dul ba khro bo'i rgyal po chen po rnams dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa 'gro ba yongs su skyob pa rnams kyang sprul pa'i lus kyi gzugs sna @111b tshogs dang mdangs dang stobs dang zhes pa ni stobs ni shed mo'o //
analyzed: ma rungs pa 'dul ba khro bo'i rgyal po chen po rnams dang / rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa 'gro ba yongs su skyob pa rnams kyang sprul pa'i lus kyi gzugs sna @111b tshogs dang mdangs dang stobs dang zhes pa ni stobs ni shed mo'o //
translated: and the great wrathful kings who tame the unruly, and those who completely protect transmigrating beings, such as Great Vajradhara, also with various forms of emanated bodies, with splendor, with strength, with splendor that cannot be overwhelmed,

original: gzi brjid zil gyis mi non pa dang zhes pa ni gzi brjid zil gyis mi gnon zhing mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid zil gyis mi non pa dang zhes pa ni gzi brjid zil gyis mi gnon zhing mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: with splendor that cannot be overwhelmed, that cannot be robbed.

original: gsang sngags dang phyag rgya rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams zhes pa ni rdo rje dbyings la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsang sngags dang phyag rgya rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams zhes pa ni rdo rje dbyings la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The maṇḍalas of the realizations of the secret mantras and mudras,

original: de rnams sgrub par byed ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams sgrub par byed ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: those are the ones that are accomplished.

original: gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi rgyal po ma lus pa dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren dag /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi rgyal po ma lus pa dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren dag /
translated: All the kings of secret mantras and knowledge mantras, and the obstructors and misleaders,

original: bdud kyi dra dang / phyir rgol pa dang / gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa chen po thams cad kyang nyin mtshan phyed par skad cig re re la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi dra dang / phyir rgol pa dang / gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa chen po thams cad kyang nyin mtshan phyed par skad cig re re la zhes pa ni /
translated: All the great snares of Mara, all the adversaries, and all the great unassailability are split in two, day and night, in every moment.

original: de la ma lus pa ni lus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma lus pa ni lus pa med pa'o //
translated: Therein, without exception means without remainder.

original: mtshan mo dang lhan cig tu gyur pas na nyin mtshan phyed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang lhan cig tu gyur pas na nyin mtshan phyed do //
translated: Day and night means together with night.

original: skad cig ma re re ni skad cig dang skad cig nyid pas skad cig re re'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re ni skad cig dang skad cig nyid pas skad cig re re'o //
translated: In every moment means in every moment, because of momentariness.

original: spyod lam thams cad ni bzhi la'o //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad ni bzhi la'o //
translated: In all activities means in the four.

original: srung ba dang skyob pa dang sped pa byed do zhes pa ni srung ba yang de skyob pa yang de rnams nyid do //
analyzed: srung ba dang skyob pa dang sped pa byed do zhes pa ni srung ba yang de skyob pa yang de rnams nyid do //
translated: He protects, guards, and shelters means that very protection, that very guarding, and that very sheltering.

original: de rnams kyi sped pa de byed pa zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sped pa de byed pa zhes so //
translated: He does that means he does that sheltering.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin gyis rlob par mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin gyis rlob par mdzad do //
translated: All the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas bless him.

original: sku gsung thugs thams cad kyis de'i rgyud la yang dag par byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs thams cad kyis de'i rgyud la yang dag par byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: All the Bodies, Speech, and Minds bless his continuum.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi phan gdags pas kyang phan gdags par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi phan gdags pas kyang phan gdags par mdzad de /
translated: and by the benefit of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, he is benefited.

original: chos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa yang grub par mdzad do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa yang grub par mdzad do zhes pa ni /
translated: and he is also established in the fearlessness of eloquence with regard to all dharmas.

original: de la chos thams cad kyi mi 'jigs pa de'i spobs pa ni chos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi mi 'jigs pa de'i spobs pa ni chos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa'o //
translated: The fearlessness of all dharmas is the fearlessness of eloquence with regard to all dharmas.

original: de sgrub par mdzad pas dbul bar mdzad ces pa'i don to //🔽dgra bcom ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i chos la sdug par 'dzin pa'i bsam pas lus ston par byed do zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos ni 'phags pa'i chos so /
analyzed: de sgrub par mdzad pas dbul bar mdzad ces pa'i don to // dgra bcom ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i chos la sdug par 'dzin pa'i bsam pas lus ston par byed do zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos ni 'phags pa'i chos so /
translated: He is established in that, i.e., he is established in the fearlessness of eloquence with regard to all dharmas.🔽All the Arhats, Sravakas, and Pratyekabuddhas also show their bodies with the intention of holding dear the Dharma of the Aryas.🔽The Dharma of the Aryas is the Dharma of the Aryas.

original: de la sdug pa ni byams pa'i blo nyid kyis rang gi lus kyi ngo bo nyid de yang nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: de la sdug pa ni byams pa'i blo nyid kyis rang gi lus kyi ngo bo nyid de yang nye bar bstan to //
translated: He holds that dear, i.e., he holds dear the Dharma of the Aryas. He also shows his own body with the intention of holding that dear.

original: tshangs pa dang / bang po dang / nye dbang dang / drag po dang / tshan po che dang / kun 'gyed gzhon nu dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / smin drug gi bu dang / nag po chen po dang / dga' byed dbang phyug dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / bang po dang / nye dbang dang / drag po dang / tshan po che dang / kun 'gyed gzhon nu dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / smin drug gi bu dang / nag po chen po dang / dga' byed dbang phyug dang /
translated: Brahmā, Īśāna, Viṣṇu, Rudra, Maheśvara, Skanda, Maheśvara, Śakra, Śiva, Kāmadeva,

original: gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / @112a * //🔽ku be ra dang / 'phrog ma dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten skyong pa gang yin pa de dag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / @112a * // ku be ra dang / 'phrog ma dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten skyong pa gang yin pa de dag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Yama, Varuṇa,

original: nyin mtshan phyad par 'gro yang rung /🔽'greng yang rung /
analyzed: nyin mtshan phyad par 'gro yang rung / 'greng yang rung /
translated: Kubera, Rāvaṇa, and the guardians of the world in the ten directions, will always, continuously, at all times,

original: 'dug kyang rung /🔽nyal yang rung /
analyzed: 'dug kyang rung / nyal yang rung /
translated: whether walking or standing,🔽whether sitting or lying down,

original: gnyid log kyang rung /🔽ma log kyang rung ba na srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sped pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid log kyang rung / ma log kyang rung ba na srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sped pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: whether sleeping or awake,🔽protect, guard, and keep them safe.

original: mnyam par bzhag kyang rung /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag kyang rung /
translated: Whether in meditative equipoise

original: ma bzhag kyang rung /
analyzed: ma bzhag kyang rung /
translated: or not,

original: gcig pur 'dug kyang rung /
analyzed: gcig pur 'dug kyang rung /
translated: whether alone or

original: skye bo mang po'i nang du 'dug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i nang du 'dug kyang rung ste /
translated: Even if he is in the midst of a crowd of people,

original: grong ni grong khyer gyi phyir rol gyi mtha' ma'o //
analyzed: grong ni grong khyer gyi phyir rol gyi mtha' ma'o //
translated: a village is the outer limit of a town.

original: grong khyer dang grong rdal ni yul lo //
analyzed: grong khyer dang grong rdal ni yul lo //
translated: A town and a city are a country.

original: ljongs ni dpya 'du ba'i sa'o //🔽yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / sra dang / sra chung dang / grong khyer gyi go dang / khri lam ni rgyal bo 'gro ba'i lam mo //🔽srang dang bzhi mdo ni lam kha brag go //🔽sum mdo ni lam sum ma do'o //🔽grong bar dang tshong khang ni 'tshong bar byed pa'i rdza 'tshong pa'o //
analyzed: ljongs ni dpya 'du ba'i sa'o // yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / sra dang / sra chung dang / grong khyer gyi go dang / khri lam ni rgyal bo 'gro ba'i lam mo // srang dang bzhi mdo ni lam kha brag go // sum mdo ni lam sum ma do'o // grong bar dang tshong khang ni 'tshong bar byed pa'i rdza 'tshong pa'o //
translated: A country is a place where taxes are collected.

original: de'i mdzod ni tshong khang ngo //🔽de la 'dug pa ni 'dug pa'o //🔽khang stong dang / ri dang / chu klung dang / nags tshal dang / nags tshang tshing ni nags kyi tshang tshing do /🔽'jug kyang rung /
analyzed: de'i mdzod ni tshong khang ngo //🔽de la 'dug pa ni 'dug pa'o //🔽khang stong dang / ri dang / chu klung dang / nags tshal dang / nags tshang tshing ni nags kyi tshang tshing do /🔽'jug kyang rung /
translated: A kingdom, a royal palace, a village, a small village, a town, a road, a path, a street, a crossroads, a junction of three or four roads, a market, a shop, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain, a cave, a hollow, a tree, a house, a temple, a monastery, a forest, a jungle, a wilderness, a desert, a mountain, a river, a lake, a pond, a well, a fountain,

original: gtsang sbra ma byas pa dang / ra ro ni chang gis gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra ma byas pa dang / ra ro ni chang gis gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He is not impure, and he is not intoxicated, because he is not changed by wine.

original: bag med pa ni dbang phyug gis gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag med pa ni dbang phyug gis gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not heedless, because he is not changed by sovereignty.

original: rtag tu rnam pa thams cad du ci'i sgo nas kyang mchog tu srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sped par byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu rnam pa thams cad du ci'i sgo nas kyang mchog tu srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sped par byed do //
translated: He is always and in every way protected, guarded, and watched over by the gods.

original: nyin mtshan du yang mchog tu bde legs su 'gyur 'gyur byed do //
analyzed: nyin mtshan du yang mchog tu bde legs su 'gyur 'gyur byed do //
translated: He is always and in every way well and happy, day and night.🔽He is always and in every way protected, guarded, and watched over by the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod spyin dang / dri za dang // lha ma yid dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / zhes pa dang / de la lto 'phye chen po ni klu'i rigs brgyad do //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod spyin dang / dri za dang // lha ma yid dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / zhes pa dang / de la lto 'phye chen po ni klu'i rigs brgyad do //
translated: Here, the mahoragas are the eight types of nāgas.

original: mi dang mi ma yin pa ni yi dvags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dang mi ma yin pa ni yi dvags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The humans and non-humans are the pretas and so on.

original: gzhan dag kyang gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / ma mo rnams dang / tshogs kyi bdag po gzhan dang / ma mo bdun po gang yin pa rnams dang / gnod spyin mo dang / srin mo dang / sha za mo gang yin pa de dag kyang 'du zhing zhes pa ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gza' dang / rgyu skar dang / ma mo rnams dang / tshogs kyi bdag po gzhan dang / ma mo bdun po gang yin pa rnams dang / gnod spyin mo dang / srin mo dang / sha za mo gang yin pa de dag kyang 'du zhing zhes pa ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: And the others, the planets, the lunar mansions, the mātṛs, the gaṇapati, the seven mātṛs, the yakṣiṇīs, the rākṣasīs, and the piśācīs, they all gather together, that is, they assemble.

original: gcig tu mthun pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dpung dang bcas pa ni yan lag gi stobs bzhi'o //
analyzed: gcig tu mthun pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dpung dang bcas pa ni yan lag gi stobs bzhi'o //
translated: With a complete army of the same mind, that is, with the fourfold army of the limbs.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa ni rjes su 'brang ba dang @112b bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa ni rjes su 'brang ba dang @112b bcas pa'o //
translated: With their retinue, that is, with their followers.

original: srung ba dang skyob pa dang sped pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srung ba dang skyob pa dang sped pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will all perform the protection, the guarding, and the sheltering.

original: mdangs dang stobs dang gzi brjod mchog kyang de'i lus la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: mdangs dang stobs dang gzi brjod mchog kyang de'i lus la 'jug par byed do //
translated: They will also cause the supreme splendor, strength, and glory to enter his body.

original: nad med pa dang stobs dang tshe nur pa yang 'grub par byed do zhes pa ni rjes su 'dogs par bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: nad med pa dang stobs dang tshe nur pa yang 'grub par byed do zhes pa ni rjes su 'dogs par bya ba'i don te //
translated: They will also accomplish the attainment of health, strength, and long life. This is the meaning of the subsequent affixation.

original: 'khor lo bzhi pa'i yon tan te de'i tshig rnams ni grangs bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi pa'i yon tan te de'i tshig rnams ni grangs bcu dgu'o //
translated: These are the qualities of the fourth wheel, and the words are nineteen.

original: de nas da ni 'khor lo lnga pa'i yon tan gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas da ni 'khor lo lnga pa'i yon tan gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, from the perspective of the qualities of the fifth wheel, it is said:

original: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, Vajradhara, and so on.

original: gzhan yang mtshan gyi gtsug gi nor bu gang gis nyin gcig bzhin du zhes pa ni nyi ma re re'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan gyi gtsug gi nor bu gang gis nyin gcig bzhin du zhes pa ni nyi ma re re'o //
translated: Moreover, the crest jewel of the name, by whom daily, means each day.

original: dus gsum du mnyam par yi dam du lan gsum du ni sum 'gyur du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du mnyam par yi dam du lan gsum du ni sum 'gyur du byas pa'o //
translated: In the three times, the vow is equal, and threefold is the repetition.

original: kha don du 'don tam glegs bam du byas ba klog cing brjod pa ni klog pa'o //
analyzed: kha don du 'don tam glegs bam du byas ba klog cing brjod pa ni klog pa'o //
translated: Reciting the text or reading the book that is written is reading.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs yid la dmigs shing /🔽gzugs dang mthun par sems te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs yid la dmigs shing / gzugs dang mthun par sems te /
translated: The Bhagavat is visualized in the form of Mañjuśrījñānasattva.🔽The mind is in accord with the form.

original: de'i gzugs dang mthun par sems te /
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang mthun par sems te /
translated: The mind is in accord with his form.

original: de'i gzugs dang mthun par bsam gtan byed pa ni zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas gzugs rnam pa gsum du rjes su bsams nas bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang mthun par bsam gtan byed pa ni zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas gzugs rnam pa gsum du rjes su bsams nas bklag par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should practice concentration in accordance with that form should be read in the same way as the above passage, following the three types of form.

original: 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir ring po mi thogs pa de nyid sprul pa'i gzugs kyi lus mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis mthong mgo //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir ring po mi thogs pa de nyid sprul pa'i gzugs kyi lus mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis mthong mgo //
translated: Due to the power of the Vinaya, one will see the emanated form body of that very one without delay. This is because of the power of mental intention.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs kyi sku rnam par sna tshogs dang ldan pa nam mkha'i dkyil na bzhugs pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs kyi sku rnam par sna tshogs dang ldan pa nam mkha'i dkyil na bzhugs pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will also see the various form bodies of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas dwelling in the midst of space.

original: sems can chen po de ni nam yang ji ltar gyur kyang dan 'gro ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sems can chen po de ni nam yang ji ltar gyur kyang dan 'gro ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: That great being will never, under any circumstances, fall into the lower realms such as the animal realm.

original: rigs ngan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gdol pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ngan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gdol pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One will not be born in a low caste, meaning such as the caṇḍāla and so on.

original: yul mtha' 'khob tu skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni grong gi mtha' gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi shes pa der skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul mtha' 'khob tu skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni grong gi mtha' gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi shes pa der skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be born in a border region, that is, in a place where the words of the Buddha are not known.

original: dbang po ma tshang bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be born with incomplete faculties.

original: mig long ba dang 'on pa dang / glen pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig long ba dang 'on pa dang / glen pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be blind, deaf, or mentally handicapped.🔽He will not be born in a family with wrong views or bad views.

original: log par lta ba dang ; lta ba ngan pa'i rigs su skye bar mi 'gyur ro ni lta ba log pa ni med par lta ba ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba dang ; lta ba ngan pa'i rigs su skye bar mi 'gyur ro ni lta ba log pa ni med par lta ba ste /
translated: Wrong views are the view of nonexistence.

original: lta ba thams cad rtsad nas 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad rtsad nas 'byin pa'o //
translated: Bad views are all views.

original: de'i rigs ni lta ba log pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de'i rigs ni lta ba log pa'i rigs so //
translated: A family with wrong views is a family of wrong views.

original: de de la mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de la mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be born in that family.

original: sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽sangs @113a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar mi 'gyur ro // sangs @113a * //
translated: He will not be born in a buddha-field where there is no buddha.

original: rgyas bzhugs na yang des bstan pa'i chos spong ba dang bskal par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas bzhugs na yang des bstan pa'i chos spong ba dang bskal par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if there is a buddha, he will not be born in a place where the Dharma taught by that buddha is rejected.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi mjal ba dang de yis bstan pa'i chos dang ma phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi mjal ba dang de yis bstan pa'i chos dang ma phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be born in a place where a Buddha has not appeared, nor will one be born where the Dharma is not taught.

original: lha tsho ring po rnams kyi nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha tsho ring po rnams kyi nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be born among the long-lived gods.

original: mu ge dang nad dang mtshon gyi bskal pa'i nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mu ge dang nad dang mtshon gyi bskal pa'i nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be born in the midst of an eon of famine, disease, or war.

original: de ltar yang chos mngon pa mdzod las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang chos mngon pa mdzod las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the Abhidharmakośa states:

original: bskal pa mtshon dang nad dang ni //
analyzed: bskal pa mtshon dang nad dang ni //
translated: The eons of war, disease, and famine

original: mu ges nges par mthar 'byin no //
analyzed: mu ges nges par mthar 'byin no //
translated: are definitely brought to an end.

original: zhag rnams dang ni zla ba dang // lo bdun dag tu go rims bzhin //
analyzed: zhag rnams dang ni zla ba dang // lo bdun dag tu go rims bzhin //
translated: In order, [they last] for seven days, seven months, and seven years.

original: zhes so // de rnams la yang skye par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de rnams la yang skye par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One will not be born in those [places].

original: snyigs ma lnga'i dus su yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro ni snyigs ma lnga ni sems can dang / tshe dang / lta ba dang / bskal pa dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga'i dus su yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro ni snyigs ma lnga ni sems can dang / tshe dang / lta ba dang / bskal pa dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: One will not be born even in the time of the five degenerations. The five degenerations are the degeneration of sentient beings, the degeneration of lifespan, the degeneration of view, the degeneration of eon, and the degeneration of afflictions, and so forth.

original: snyigs ma'i dbyings ni snyigs ma'i phyir dang / gzir ba'i phyir ni snyigs ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snyigs ma'i dbyings ni snyigs ma'i phyir dang / gzir ba'i phyir ni snyigs ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: The realm of the dregs is called dregs because of dregs and because of being oppressed.

original: de'i dus la yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dus la yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And he will be born at that time.

original: rgyal po dang dang drag dang chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dang dang drag dang chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be no fear of kings, of violent people, or of robbers.

original: ci nas kyang dman pa dang dbul ba'i 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dman pa dang dbul ba'i 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be no fear of being low or poor.

original: gos la sogs pa'i yo byang thams cad dang bral ba'i dbul ba'i 'jigs pa de yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa'i yo byang thams cad dang bral ba'i dbul ba'i 'jigs pa de yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be no fear of poverty, of being without all the necessities such as clothing.

original: dri ngas dang skur pa dang / smad pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / gtam ngan gyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ngas dang skur pa dang / smad pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / gtam ngan gyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be no fear of slander, of being accused, of being reviled, of being spoken to harshly, or of hearing bad news.

original: dri ngas la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dri ngas la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Slander and so on have already been explained.

original: de yang bskal pa stong gi bar du yang de'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bskal pa stong gi bar du yang de'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And for a thousand eons, there will be no fear of that.

original: rgyud dang rus dang / rigs bzang po dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud dang rus dang / rigs bzang po dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will have good lineage, family, and caste.

original: kun nas mdzes pa dang gzugs dang kha dog dang ldan par 'gyur ro ni //
analyzed: kun nas mdzes pa dang gzugs dang kha dog dang ldan par 'gyur ro ni //
translated: He will be completely beautiful, with a good figure and complexion.

original: kun ni thams cad do //
analyzed: kun ni thams cad do //
translated: All means all.

original: de rnams kyis ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be endowed with them.

original: 'jig rten rnams la sdug pa ni tshig 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la sdug pa ni tshig 'jam pa'o //
translated: He will be dear to the world means he will be dear to all beings.

original: yid du 'od ba ni sems can thams cad kyi yid la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'od ba ni sems can thams cad kyi yid la khyab pa'o //
translated: He will be pleasing means he will be pleasing to the minds of all beings.

original: 'grogs na bde ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grogs na bde ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He will be delightful to be with means he will be delightful to be with because he is free from suffering.

original: mthong ba dga' bar 'gyur ro ni mdzes pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dga' bar 'gyur ro ni mdzes pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He will be delightful to see means he will be delightful to see because he has a beautiful form.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten rnams la'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten rnams la'o //
translated: To the world of beings.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa dang tshig btsan par yang 'gyur ro ni gang dge ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa dang tshig btsan pa de de ltar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa dang tshig btsan par yang 'gyur ro ni gang dge ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa dang tshig btsan pa de de ltar sbyar ro //
translated: He will be fortunate and his word will be authoritative means he will be endowed with the fortune of virtue and his word will be authoritative.

original: gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur @113b ro ;
analyzed: gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur @113b ro ;
translated: Wherever he is born, there he will remember his former lives.

original: / longs spyod kyi gzhi chen po ni nor dang 'brul sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: / longs spyod kyi gzhi chen po ni nor dang 'brul sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: He will have a great basis for enjoyment means he will have wealth, grain, etc.

original: 'khor mang ba ni bran g-yog dang skye bo mang po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor mang ba ni bran g-yog dang skye bo mang po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Great retinue means the perfection of many servants and people.

original: longs spyod kyi gzi mi zad pa dang 'khor mi zad par 'gyur ro ni ji tsa ma 'tsho'i par du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi gzi mi zad pa dang 'khor mi zad par 'gyur ro ni ji tsa ma 'tsho'i par du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He will have inexhaustible wealth and an inexhaustible retinue, because they will be uninterrupted as long as he lives.

original: sems can thams cad cad kyi mchog tu ni mdun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad cad kyi mchog tu ni mdun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: He will be the best of all sentient beings, because he goes in front of them.

original: yon tan gyi mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro ni 'byor pa nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan gyi mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro ni 'byor pa nyid do //
translated: He will have the best qualities, because he is endowed with them.

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will naturally have the qualities of the six perfections.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi la yang gnas par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi la yang gnas par 'gyur ro /
translated: He will also abide in the four divine abodes.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang thabs dang stobs dang smon lam dang ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur ro ni de dag gi don go bar zad do //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang thabs dang stobs dang smon lam dang ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur ro ni de dag gi don go bar zad do //
translated: He will have mindfulness, introspection, means, strength, aspiration, and wisdom, the meaning of which is understood.

original: bstan bcos thams cad la 'jigs pa med pa ni mi skrag pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad la 'jigs pa med pa ni mi skrag pa'o //
translated: He will be fearless in all treatises, because he is not afraid.

original: smra mkhas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra mkhas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also be eloquent.

original: mi blun pa ni shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi blun pa ni shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The fool becomes wise.

original: tshig gsal ba ni gsal por smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gsal ba ni gsal por smra ba'o //
translated: Clear speech is speaking clearly.

original: sgrin por yang 'gyur ro ni spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrin por yang 'gyur ro ni spobs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He becomes clever, that is, eloquent.

original: shes nyen can ni byas pa kun la mos pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shes nyen can ni byas pa kun la mos pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He becomes skillful, that is, he is devoted to all duties.

original: le lo med pa ni dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: le lo med pa ni dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa'o //
translated: He becomes diligent, that is, he is devoted to the side of virtue.

original: chog shes pa ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chog shes pa ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He becomes content, because he has few desires.

original: don che pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don che pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He becomes magnanimous, because he works for the welfare of all beings.

original: srid pa med par yang 'gyur ro ni yul thams cad la mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa med par yang 'gyur ro ni yul thams cad la mi lta ba'o //
translated: He becomes free from existence, because he is not attached to any object.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu yid brtan par bya ba ni gdon mi za par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu yid brtan par bya ba ni gdon mi za par bya ba'o //
translated: He becomes trustworthy to all beings, because he is reliable.

original: slob dpon dang bla ma bkur bar yang 'gyur ro ni bkur 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dang bla ma bkur bar yang 'gyur ro ni bkur 'dod pa'o //
translated: He becomes respectful to teachers and gurus, because he desires to honor them.

original: des sngon ma thos pa'i bzod dang / sgyur rtsa la dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bstan bcos thams cad kyang don dang yi ge'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sngon ma thos pa'i bzod dang / sgyur rtsa la dang / mngon par shes pa dang / bstan bcos thams cad kyang don dang yi ge'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, one will understand the meaning and the words of all the treatises, even those that one has not heard before, such as the treatises on the perfection of wisdom, the treatises on logic, the treatises on grammar, the treatises on the arts and crafts, the treatises on the Vinaya, the treatises on the Abhidharma, the treatises on the sutras, the treatises on the bodhisattvas, the treatises on the worldly arts and crafts, and the treatises on the worldly arts and crafts.

original: de dag ni don go bar zad do //🔽tshul khrims dang / 'tsho ba dang / kun du spyod pa shin tu yongs su dag par spyod pa dang / legs par rab tu byung ba dang / legs par bsnyen par rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa la legs par yangs su dag pa ni shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa des 'tsho bar gnas pa de nyid kyis yang dag par spyod pa'i tha snyad des spyod pa'i tshul dang gang ldan🔽pa de de ltar te /🔽log par 'tsho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni don go bar zad do // tshul khrims dang / 'tsho ba dang / kun du spyod pa shin tu yongs su dag par spyod pa dang / legs par rab tu byung ba dang / legs par bsnyen par rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa la legs par yangs su dag pa ni shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa des 'tsho bar gnas pa de nyid kyis yang dag par spyod pa'i tha snyad des spyod pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de de ltar te / log par 'tsho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of these is already understood.

original: legs par rab tu byung ba ni tshul khrims mnyam pa'i @114a * //
analyzed: legs par rab tu byung ba ni tshul khrims mnyam pa'i @114a * //
translated: One will practice with extremely pure morality, livelihood, and conduct, and will be well-gone forth and well-ordained. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who is ordained well. Well-gone forth means one who has gone forth well. Well-ordained means one who

original: phyir ro // legs par bsnyen par rdzogs par byung ba ni tshul khrims la ral ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ro // legs par bsnyen par rdzogs par byung ba ni tshul khrims la ral ba med pa'o //
translated: One who has gone forth and is well-practiced in the precepts is one whose morality is not torn.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhes pa la /
translated: One will not even utter the thought of enlightenment of omniscience.

original: mi brjed pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang gang ldan pa de de ltar ro //🔽nyan thos dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi nges pa la nams kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi brjed pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang gang ldan pa de de ltar ro // nyan thos dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi nges pa la nams kyang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is not forgetful is one who possesses the thought of enlightenment of omniscience.🔽One will never enter into the certainty of a śrāvaka, arhat, or pratyekabuddha.

original: nyan thos dang dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi nges pa de'i byang chub myur ba rnams kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi nges pa de'i byang chub myur ba rnams kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not even become a śrāvaka, arhat, or pratyekabuddha.

original: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i sgo nas yon tan rnams kyi mthar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i sgo nas yon tan rnams kyi mthar gsungs pa'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, the bearer of the vajra, is said to be the limit of the qualities in terms of the summary.

original: de ltar yang yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang yon tan dpag tu med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one will come to possess immeasurable qualities.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa de ltar yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa de ltar yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the same way, he will attain the practice of the conduct through the door of mantra.

original: gzhan yang rnams pa de lta bu'i yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa ni de dang ris mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnams pa de lta bu'i yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa ni de dang ris mthun pa'o //
translated: And he will also attain an immeasurable collection of qualities of that kind, which are of the same type.

original: gzhan dang yang ldan bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang yang ldan bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And he will also attain other qualities.

original: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang don dam mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di yang dag par 'dzin pa'i skyes bu gang zag de ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don do //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang don dam mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di yang dag par 'dzin pa'i skyes bu gang zag de ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don do //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, Vajradhara, that person who upholds this ultimate dhāraṇī of the true nature will be called the chief.

original: de nyid yi phyir na /
analyzed: de nyid yi phyir na /
translated: And for that very reason,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags shing sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams shin tu myur du ni thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags shing sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams shin tu myur du ni thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: he will quickly and without obstruction accumulate the collections of merit and wisdom and attain the qualities of a buddha.

original: bsgrubs pa ni bzung pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa ni bzung pa'o //
translated: He will accomplish them.

original: ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood without delay.

original: bskal pa mang por yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos su mi 'gyur bar sems can thams cad la bla na med pa'i chos ston pa dang / phyogs bcur dam pa'i chos kyi rnga sgra chen po rgyun mi 'chad par sgrogs pa'i chos kyi rgyal po chen por 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: bskal pa mang por yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos su mi 'gyur bar sems can thams cad la bla na med pa'i chos ston pa dang / phyogs bcur dam pa'i chos kyi rnga sgra chen po rgyun mi 'chad par sgrogs pa'i chos kyi rgyal po chen por 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: He will teach the unsurpassed Dharma to all sentient beings, so that they will not become the Dharma of complete nirvana for many eons, and he will become the great Dharma king who continuously proclaims the great sound of the holy Dharma in the ten directions.

original: 'khor lo nga ba'i yon tan te /
analyzed: 'khor lo nga ba'i yon tan te /
translated: This is the quality of the wheel.

original: de'i tshigs bcad kyi grangs lnga bcu rtsa gcig go //🔽de nas lag na rdo rje zhes pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i tshigs bcad kyi grangs lnga bcu rtsa gcig go // de nas lag na rdo rje zhes pa nas brtsams te /
translated: It has fifty-one verses.

original: dzi tsam chos kyi rgyal po zhes pa'i bar du yon tan rnam pa gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: dzi tsam chos kyi rgyal po zhes pa'i bar du yon tan rnam pa gcig tu byas te /
translated: Then, starting from Vajrapani up to Jicham Dharma King, the qualities are made into one.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las yon tan gyi rim par phye ba ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las yon tan gyi rim par phye ba ste bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the twelfth chapter on the qualities from the commentary on the Arya-nama-samgīti called The View of the Meaning of the Secret Mantras.

original: // / de nas da ni drug pa byang chub kyi sems rdo rje shes rab @114b kyi 'khor lo'i dang po sangs rgyas kyi thugs kar bsgoms pa gang yin pa de la bkod pa'i sngags kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / de nas da ni drug pa byang chub kyi sems rdo rje shes rab @114b kyi 'khor lo'i dang po sangs rgyas kyi thugs kar bsgoms pa gang yin pa de la bkod pa'i sngags kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the sixth, the mantra empowerment of the bodhicitta vajra, which was meditated on in the heart of the Buddha at the beginning of the wheel of wisdom, is stated from the perspective of the mantra.

original: aom sarbba dharm'a bh'a ba sva bh'a wa bi shuddha badzra aa a'a aom aa:/
analyzed: aom sarbba dharm'a bh'a ba sva bh'a wa bi shuddha badzra aa a'a aom aa:/
translated: Oṃ sarvadharmabhāvasvabhāva viśuddha vajra āḥ āḥ āḥ oṃ aḥ.

original: zhes pa de mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de'i rtsa ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: zhes pa de mtshan yang dag par brjod pa de'i rtsa ba'i sngags so //
translated: This is the root mantra of the Tathāgataguhya.

original: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha:sarbba dha rm'a zhes pa ni lhun gyis grub pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha:sarbba dha rm'a zhes pa ni lhun gyis grub pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: Prakṛtipariśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ.

original: pra kri ta pa ri shuddha de gang zhe na /🔽srab dharm'a ste /
analyzed: pra kri ta pa ri shuddha de gang zhe na / srab dharm'a ste /
translated: What is that prakṛtipariśuddha?🔽Sarvadharmāḥ.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: All phenomena, such as the aggregates.

original: ya du ta sarbba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na ka ya manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi t'a ni yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi bzhin gang yin pa de /
analyzed: ya du ta sarbba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na ka ya manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi t'a ni yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi bzhin gang yin pa de /
translated: Yaduta sarvatathāgatas jñānakāya mañjuśrīpariśuddhitāni are the phenomena that are completely pure.

original: mu p'a d'a ya ti ni khas blang ngo //
analyzed: mu p'a d'a ya ti ni khas blang ngo //
translated: Mūpādayati means I accept.

original: gzung bar bya'o /
analyzed: gzung bar bya'o /
translated: One should hold.

original: zhes pa'o // aa a'a: aom srab ta th'a ga ta hri da ya /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // aa a'a: aom srab ta th'a ga ta hri da ya /
translated: A āḥ oṃ svabhāva śuddha sarvadharma svabhāva śuddho 'haṃ.

original: lha ra lha ra /
analyzed: lha ra lha ra /
translated: Dehar deha.🔽 Oṃ hūṃ hrīḥ.

original: aom h'um hr'i:/ bha ga b'an /
analyzed: aom h'um hr'i:/ bha ga b'an /
translated: Bhagavān.

original: dzny'a na murti //
analyzed: dzny'a na murti //
translated: Jñānamurti.

original: w'a g'i shva ra /
analyzed: w'a g'i shva ra /
translated: Vāgīśvara.

original: ma h'a w'a tsa /
analyzed: ma h'a w'a tsa /
translated: Mahāvāca.

original: srab dha rm'a /
analyzed: srab dha rm'a /
translated: Svabhāva dharma.

original: ga ga na /🔽aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha y'a:zhes pa ni 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: ga ga na / aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha y'a:zhes pa ni 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba'o //
translated: Gagana.🔽Amalasupariśuddha dharmadhātu jñānagarbhāya.🔽This is the mantra garland of the Noble Mañjuśrī's Praise in Verse.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las shes rab kyi 'khor lo la bskong pa'i sngags kyi rim par phye ba ste bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las shes rab kyi 'khor lo la bskong pa'i sngags kyi rim par phye ba ste bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: From the commentary on the Noble Mañjuśrī's Praise in Verse, called The View of the Meaning of the Secret Mantra, this completes the thirteenth chapter on the sequence of mantras in the turning of the wheel of wisdom.

original: // / de nas da ni bsdus pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas lag na rdo rje mang po dang lhan cig gis mgon po zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: // / de nas da ni bsdus pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pas lag na rdo rje mang po dang lhan cig gis mgon po zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Now, having paid homage to the Blessed One, Vajradhara, together with many Vajrapāṇis, by way of summary, the Lord, who is the nature of mirror-like wisdom,

original: bcom ldan zhes pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan zhes pa ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the Blessed One, who is the nature of the wisdom of discrimination, the Tathāgata, who is the essence of the wisdom of successful activity,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi gzugs so //
translated: the perfect Buddha, who is the form of the wisdom of equality,

original: de ltar ye shes bzhi'i bdag nyid sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes bzhi'i bdag nyid sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: having thus paid homage to Śākyamuni, who is the nature of the four wisdoms,

original: gsang bstod nas ni tshig 'di gsol //
analyzed: gsang bstod nas ni tshig 'di gsol //
translated: having praised the secret, he spoke these words.

original: zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with the verse above.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: Then, the glorious Vajradhara,

original: dga' zhing mgu nas thal mo sbyar //🔽mgon po bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: dga' zhing mgu nas thal mo sbyar // mgon po bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs //
translated: delighted and pleased, with palms joined,🔽having paid homage to the Lord, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: the perfect Buddha,

original: de ni mgon po gsang ba'i bdag / lag na rdo rje khro bo'i rgyal //
analyzed: de ni mgon po gsang ba'i bdag / lag na rdo rje khro bo'i rgyal //
translated: Vajrapani, the king of wrathful ones.

original: sna tshogs gzhan dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzhan dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Together with various others,

original: gsang bstod nas ni tshig 'di gsol //
analyzed: gsang bstod nas ni tshig 'di gsol //
translated: he praised the secret and spoke these words:

original: mgon pa bdag cag yi @115a * //
analyzed: mgon pa bdag cag yi @115a * //
translated: O Lord, we rejoice!

original: rang ngo ; / legs so legs so legs par gsungs //🔽bdag cag yang dag rdzogs pa yi //
analyzed: rang ngo ; / legs so legs so legs par gsungs // bdag cag yang dag rdzogs pa yi //
translated: Excellent, excellent, well spoken!🔽You have accomplished the great purpose

original: byang chub thob pa'i don chen mdzad //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa'i don chen mdzad //
translated: of attaining perfect, complete enlightenment for us.

original: ces pa ni de la //
analyzed: ces pa ni de la //
translated: This is what he said.

original: kye mgon po bdag cag yi rang ngo //🔽legs so legs so legs par gsungs so //
analyzed: kye mgon po bdag cag yi rang ngo // legs so legs so legs par gsungs so //
translated: O Lord, we rejoice!🔽Excellent, excellent, well spoken!

original: shin tu gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs so //
analyzed: shin tu gsungs pa ni legs par gsungs so //
translated: Very well spoken!

original: bdag cag gi don che byas so //
analyzed: bdag cag gi don che byas so //
translated: You have accomplished the great purpose for us.

original: don ci 'dra ba zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: don ci 'dra ba zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What kind of purpose? It is said:

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa ni sangs rgyas thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa ni sangs rgyas thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Attaining perfect, complete enlightenment is causing the attainment of buddhahood.

original: rnam grol 'bras bu 'tshal pa yi //
analyzed: rnam grol 'bras bu 'tshal pa yi //
translated: For those who seek the fruit of liberation,

original: 'gro ba mgon med rnams kyi yang //
analyzed: 'gro ba mgon med rnams kyi yang //
translated: for beings without a protector,

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tshul ston pa //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tshul ston pa //
translated: showing the way of the net of illusion,

original: 'di ni rnam dag legs pa'i lam //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam dag legs pa'i lam //
translated: this is the pure, excellent path.

original: zhes pa ni de la bdag cag nyi tsho'i ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la bdag cag nyi tsho'i ma yin te /
translated: This is not our own idea.

original: mgon po sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tshul 'di ni //🔽rnam grol 'bras bu 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: mgon po sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tshul 'di ni // rnam grol 'bras bu 'dod pa yi //
translated: This method of the Lord's magical net🔽is the great meaning

original: 'gro ba mgon med rnams kyi yang don chen yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba mgon med rnams kyi yang don chen yin no //
translated: for beings who are without a protector and who desire the fruit of liberation.

original: de ci 'dra zhes na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra zhes na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rnam dag ces te /
analyzed: rnam dag ces te /
translated: It is pure,

original: chos kyi dbyings yi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the realm of reality.

original: legs pa'i lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the good path, because it is the cause of nirvana.

original: zab zing yangs la rgya che ste //
analyzed: zab zing yangs la rgya che ste //
translated: It is profound, vast, and extensive,

original: don chen 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
analyzed: don chen 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
translated: of great meaning, and it benefits beings.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul 'di ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul 'di ni //
translated: This domain of the buddhas

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis bshad //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis bshad //
translated: is explained by all perfect buddhas.

original: ces pa ni de la don ci'i phyir na zab cing yangs pa'i don che ba yin pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: ces pa ni de la don ci'i phyir na zab cing yangs pa'i don che ba yin pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul yin te /
translated: Here, the reason why it is profound, vast, and of great meaning is that it is the domain of the buddhas,

original: nyan thos la sos pa gzhan rnams kyi ni ma yin na /
analyzed: nyan thos la sos pa gzhan rnams kyi ni ma yin na /
translated: not of other hearers and so forth.

original: de ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'gro ba'i don byed pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don byed pa zhes pa ste /
translated: It is that which benefits beings.

original: snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos yongs su bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is completely taken hold of by great compassion.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis bshad //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyis bshad //
translated: It is explained by all the perfect Buddhas.

original: ces pa ni dus gsum la gnas pa'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces pa ni dus gsum la gnas pa'i rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained by the perfect Buddhas abiding in the three times.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las bsdus pa'i rim par phye ba ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba las bsdus pa'i rim par phye ba ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourteenth chapter of the detailed explanation of the noble “Sutra of the Ultimate Expanse,” called “The View of the Meaning of the Secret Mantra.”

original: // / bdag gi blo gros 'dra ba'i nus pas mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i tshul la ni //
analyzed: // / bdag gi blo gros 'dra ba'i nus pas mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i tshul la ni //
translated: With the power of intelligence like mine, in the method of the recitation of the names,

original: blo gros zhan pas gzung bar dka' ba'i rim pas rnam par 'grel pa byas pa yin //
analyzed: blo gros zhan pas gzung bar dka' ba'i rim pas rnam par 'grel pa byas pa yin //
translated: I have composed this commentary with a sequence difficult to grasp due to my feeble intelligence.

original: de yi dge bas dri ma med pa grangs med thob pas sems can sdug bsngal ba'i //
analyzed: de yi dge bas dri ma med pa grangs med thob pas sems can sdug bsngal ba'i //
translated: By that virtue, may countless beings attain stainlessness,

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags zhi bar byas nas mchog gi byang @115b chub dam pa thob gyur cig //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags zhi bar byas nas mchog gi byang @115b chub dam pa thob gyur cig //
translated: and having pacified the desire for existence, may they attain supreme, excellent enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba rgya gar gyi mkhan po sgeg pa'i rdo rje nyi ma can gyi rin po che gling na bzhugs pa dpal ldan byang chub mchog gi
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa mtshan gsang sngags kyi don du rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba rgya gar gyi mkhan po sgeg pa'i rdo rje nyi ma can gyi rin po che gling na bzhugs pa dpal ldan byang chub mchog gi
translated: The Commentary on the Extensive Version of the Noble Supramundane Victor's Sutra of the Noble One's Activity, called the Mirror of Poetics, by the Indian master Ratnavajra, who lived in the land of jewels in the land of the sun, the glorious supreme enlightenment.🔽

original: sla ba dang ldan pa gang gi mtshan dpal sna tshogs gzugs can du grags pa des mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sla ba dang ldan pa gang gi mtshan dpal sna tshogs gzugs can du grags pa des mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the noble Mañjuśrī's Praise of the Rare and Supreme, called The View of the Meaning of the Secret Mantra, was composed by the Indian master Sundaravajrasūryaratna, who resides in the land of jewels, the glorious supreme awakening, whose name is renowned as Śrī-Viśvarūpa.🔽It is completed.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po smri ti dzny'a na k'i rtis bsgyur te bshad nas gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po smri ti dzny'a na k'i rtis bsgyur te bshad nas gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: It was translated, explained, and finalized by the Indian abbot Smṛtijñānakīrti.

original: phyis rgya gar gyi mkhan po phyag na rdo rje dang / lo ts'a ba klog skya shes rab brtsegs kyis bcos nas gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: phyis rgya gar gyi mkhan po phyag na rdo rje dang / lo ts'a ba klog skya shes rab brtsegs kyis bcos nas gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: Later, it was revised and finalized by the Indian abbot Vajrapāṇi and the translator Klog skya Shes rab tseg.

original: 'di la gzhung tshad ni shlo ka nyis stong lnga brgya'o//
analyzed: 'di la gzhung tshad ni shlo ka nyis stong lnga brgya'o//
translated: The length of this text is 2,500 ślokas.
